Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Medior Data Analyst - Amsterdam | 40 hours




Urban Gym Group is an industry pioneer within the European wellness and fitness community, with over 40 clubs and studios in major cities across the Netherlands and The United Kingdom. You might know us from brands such as Trainmore, ClubSportive, Renessence, BTY CLB, TRIB3, PILAT3S and Gymbox. Our ambitious domestic and international growth plans require an expansion of our Business Intelligence team.




We are looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will play a key part in driving our data-driven decision-making, making a significant impact on our continued success. Working closely with our Finance, Marketing, and Analytics teams, you will extract valuable insights from our data, helping us optimise operations, enhance member experiences, and support our ambitious growth plans.




Key responsibilities:

Conduct market research and analyses to identify new club locations.
Develop business cases for club expansion, including new builds, mergers, and acquisitions.
Build ETL processes to structure data from various sources for business use.
Create data views, tables, and reports supporting daily operations and strategic goals.
Design dashboards that enable informed, data-driven decisions.
Analyze growth to identify high-performing areas and new opportunities.
Query databases for insights on key metrics like revenue and member retention.
Use data to boost member retention, inform marketing strategies, and support revenue growth.




You:

2 to 4 years of experience in a data-focused role (e.g., Data Analyst, Data Engineer, or BI Specialist).
Proven expertise in data pipeline creation, data visualization, and analytics.
Advanced proficiency in SQL with a strong understanding of Azure SQL.
Hands-on experience building ETL pipelines, ideally using Python or Azure Synapse Analytics.
Proficient in Power BI, with a track record of designing impactful dashboards and reports.
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
Industry experience in fitness/wellness or retail is preferred, with insights into customer retention, revenue optimization, and business expansion.
Experience in consulting or retail is an asset, especially in roles focused on addressing business challenges.
Able to communicate complex data insights in a clear, actionable format for non-technical audiences.
You are based in or around Amsterdam




We offer:

A competitive salary plus 8% holiday pay
Hybrid way of working
26 holidays per year (based on full-time employment) and the option to exchange public holidays
Unlimited access to all our high-end fitness locations for you and a +1
Unlimited access to well-being services for you and your family via OpenUp
An inspiring head office, a short 10-minute walk from Amsterdam Central Station
A diverse and energetic team of 500 colleagues pushing boundaries and supporting one another

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the job




Are you passionate about using data to make a real-world impact in cyber security? As a Data Analyst you won’t just analyze data, you’ll also help safeguard the digital backbone of one of the Netherlands' leading financial organizations. You'll uncover opportunities, flag security issues, and translate complex data into clear strategies and visual stories that drive action.




What you’ll do




• Detect potential security threats and vulnerabilities

• Analyze data to derive insights

• Craft strategies to mitigate risks







Your Expertise




We’re looking for a data-driven thinker who thrives in complexity and knows how to turn data into insight and insight into action. You’re a team player with strong communication skills and technical know-how, ready to contribute to an evolving security landscape.




You’ll bring




• A Bachelor's or Master’s degree in a data-related field.

• At least 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst.

• A sharp analytical mind with a proactive, problem-solving attitude.

• Proficiency in Power BI (including Power Query, DAX, Power BI Service).

• PL-300 certification (or willingness to obtain it)

• Comfort working with SQL, Databricks, and Azure (preferred).

• Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills.




Bonus if you have




• Domain knowledge in cybersecurity (e.g. identity and access management, cybercrime, risk mitigation).

• Familiarity with Agile-Scrum methodologies.







What to Expect




• An environment that values cooperation, creativity, and data excellence.

• Opportunities to work on meaningful challenges

• Competitive salary between €5.800 to €6.250 gross per month, based on 40hr per week

• 1 year contract with the possibility of extension

• 25 vacation days




About the Client




Our client is a key player in the financial sector, known for its innovative approach of technology and data. They focus on developing advanced digital solutions that make financial services smarter, faster and more secure.

With a strong emphasis on IT-driven innovation, they offer an exciting environment for professionals eager to work on impact full projects in areas like security, automation, cloud solutions and data analytics.




Apply now




Are you the Data Analyst we are looking for?

Let's connect!







Oksana Tafani: +31682096224

oksanatafani@yorteam.nl

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Data Analyst


As a preferred supplier to one of our biggest Clients, I am seeking for a Data Analyst for a position in Amsterdam, Netherlands. As a Data Analyst for our Operations BI Product Team you will have a large scope and wide stakeholder landscape to keep you always learning something new about airport operations. You will help your stakeholders to fine tune existing KPIs or explore new ones, and align definitions against the vast datasets at your disposal. You will be in the frontline of creating tangible intelligence that will be used in decision making by colleagues ranging from management to those in critical operational roles.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Join the key Business Intelligence team dedicated to support our stakeholders in the Operations Domain with accurate actionable performance dashboards and insights;
  • Understand the business and the potential to optimize their processes and help formulating the most relevant business and analysis questions;
  • Define meaningful KPIs together with business stakeholders and perform data analyses to translate these functional definitions into precise logic and calculations;
  • Explore, assess and validate the data quality and usability of existing and new datasets;
  • Ensure consistent interpretation of KPIs across different stakeholder groups by formalizing and documenting definitions;
  • Act as a bridge between business requirements and BI development (back-end and front-end) to ensure alignment between requirements and end results.


Key Requirements:

  • 3+ years of working in a data team, with meaningful experience in data analytics. Aviation-related experience is a big plus;
  • HBO-level education in engineering, econometrics, sciences, business analytics, or related with a strong quantitative component;
  • Experience in translating business requirements to data products, insights and KPIs;
  • Ability to tell compelling stories with data and present outcomes effectively to stakeholders;
  • Comfortable participating in Agile ceremonies and adhering to Scrum processes;
  • Proficiency in analytical tools and programming languages, particularly Python and relevant libraries such as Pandas, Pyspark and Plotly or Matplotlib. - Knowledge of Streamlit is a plus;
  • Experience working in PowerBI, and familiar with related concepts such as semantic models and DAX;
  • Knowledge of Collibra is a plus;
  • Excellent communication skills, including fluency in Dutch and a good working level of English is required.


Contract: 6+ months

Rates: Excellent

Location: Amsterdam

Hours: 32 hours/week

Interview: 2 stages, 1 technical + 1 assessment


Nick Chinweerapunt

Account Manager

Gazelle Global Consulting

Tel +31 85 111 0171

Tel +44 203 588 7747

Mob +44 7377 403 773

nick@gazellegc.com

Title: Business / Data Analyst
Description:
Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.

Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.

Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.

Be a productive member of the team.





Requirements


Develop comprehensive business cases and perform stakeholder analyses to align data initiatives with organizational goals.

Create, manage, and maintain data dictionaries and business glossaries to ensure consistent data usage and understanding.

Analyze, normalize, and optimize database structures for improved performance and data integrity.

Support the design and rollout of data governance frameworks and policies.

Provide expert guidance on data quality, data architecture, and data reusability best practices.

Design and deliver insightful reports and dashboards to facilitate data-driven decision-making.

Contribute to change management and continuous improvement initiatives across multiple projects.

Minimum HBO+ (Bachelor’s level or higher) working and thinking level.

Extensive experience as a Business Analyst or Data Analyst.

Demonstrated success in developing and implementing data governance frameworks.

In-depth knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM), data modeling, and translating complex business requirements into actionable solutions.

Strong stakeholder engagement and relationship-building skills.

Proficiency with tools such as Power BI, SQL, and SAP ERP.

Familiarity with methodologies including Agile/Scrum, PMBOK, and DMBOK.

Experience analyzing and optimizing information flows, preferably in supply chain or retail environments.

Experience supporting organizational change and transformation initiatives.

Understanding of data architecture in educational institutions.

Knowledge of reporting and dashboard development standards.

Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities.

Results-driven with a proactive mindset.

Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.

High level of organizational awareness and sensitivity.

Influential and persuasive, with a collaborative team-oriented approach.




Benefits


A challenging, innovating environment.

Opportunities for learning where needed.

Title: Research & Insights Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

We Are Social is a global socially-led creative agency with unrivalled social media expertise. With over 15 offices worldwide, we deliver a global perspective to our clients in a time when social media is shaping culture. We Are Social Amsterdam has been a hub for innovative, impactful creative campaigns driven by cultural and social insights since 2021.

At We Are Social, we foster a culture of creativity, collaboration, and adaptability. Our team thrives on pushing boundaries, exploring bold ideas, and delivering work that makes a meaningful impact for leading global brands.

The Opportunity

Are you passionate about managing research projects and delivering compelling, actionable insights?

Do you have a proactive and solution-oriented approach to data?

Are you skilled at designing and implementing research methodologies tailored to specific needs?

We are looking for a Research & Insight Analyst for We Are Social Amsterdam to manage end-to-end research projects, including design, setup, execution and presentation. You will work closely with internal teams and clients to recommend suitable research solutions and ensure the quality of deliverables.

Requirements

What You'll Have Delivered Elsewhere


Managed research projects, including design, setup, workflow, and resource management.
Mastered research and analytical skills at an advanced level.
Designed and implemented research methodologies tailored to specific needs and contexts.
Stayed updated on platform-specific metrics and changes in the social and digital landscape.
Utilized analytical tools, such as social listening, performance measurement tools, and databases.
Presented and explained findings effectively to diverse audiences, including clients and internal stakeholders.
Developed compelling storytelling based on research insights.
Provided actionable recommendations aligned with business goals.


What Else Are We Looking For?


Experience: 3+ years of experience in research, data analysis, or a similar field, preferably within an agency environment.
Advanced knowledge of social listening tools (eg. Brandwatch), and ideally digital research platforms (eg. GWI)
Passion for the digital world and familiarity with key social networks, such as Instagram, Facebook, X, TikTok, Twitch, YouTube, and Discord.
Proven ability to extract insights from raw aggregated data.
Strong knowledge of Google Workspace tools (Docs, Sheets, Slides) as well as Excel and PowerPoint for data analysis and presentations.
A keen eye for detail.
Demonstrates a proactive approach to identifying and exploring new data sources and research methodologies to uncover actionable insights.
Ability to present complex data in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical audiences
Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.


Benefits

Life at We Are Social Amsterdam

We Are Social Amsterdam Is An Equal Opportunity Employer. We Celebrate Diversity And Inclusion, Ensuring That Everyone Feels Valued And Empowered To Contribute To Our Shared Success. We Offer


Career Path Design: Regular reviews and mentorship to support professional growth.
WAS Passport: Opportunity to work for two weeks per year in any of our global network offices.
Training Programs: Access to professional development initiatives and creative workshops.
Diversity and Wellbeing: Participate in mental health, CSR, and diversity & inclusion activities.
Flexible Working: Up to three remote working days per week.


If this all sounds like the place you have been waiting to find then apply now! What are you waiting for?

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Gezocht: Senior Data / Business Analist | Utrecht | Salaris tot € 90K




Tech: Azure | Data Vault | SQL | Python




Voor een toonaangevende organisatie in financiële producten, zoals verzekeringen, pensioenen en hypotheken, zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren Senior Data- Business Analist. Deze marktleider, die bekend staat om zijn sterke focus op duurzaamheid, bevindt zich momenteel in een complexe migratieperiode na de overname van een grote concurrent.




Als Senior Data- Business Analist maak je deel uit van het data-klantcontactteam, waar je verantwoordelijk bent voor het ophalen van business requirements en het vertalen hiervan naar Features/EPICS en User Stories. Je zorgt voor de automatisering van bedrijfsprocessen en bent op de hoogte van de lopende processen aan zowel de data engineering- als de businesskant.




Wij zoeken een kandidaat met:

Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als Business Analist.
Meerdere jaren ervaring in een rol als data engineering of data-analyse met tools als SQL, Python, Data Vault en PowerBI
Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in het Nederlands.
Ervaring met SCRUM/Agile werken.




We komen graag met je in contact als je het leuk vindt om vanuit een technische data-achtergrond bedrijfsprocessen te verbeteren en de spin in het web te zijn tussen Data Engineers en Business Stakeholders. Solliciteer via nielsv@doghouse-recruitment.nl of via de "Nu solliciteren" button.




Salaris: Tot € 90K

Locatie: Utrecht (hybride)

Title: Data Analist
HTML:
Als Data Analyst bij DHL eCommerce ben jij de sleutel tot het onderhouden, uitbreiden, rapporteren en analyseren van onze operationele (stuur)informatie. Je zorgt ervoor dat onze informatie altijd accuraat en up-to-date is, zodat we de beste service kunnen bieden aan onze klanten. In een dynamisch netwerk houd je de ontwikkelingen scherp in de gaten, bijvoorbeeld door het begeleiden van aanpassingen in de businesslogica naar aanleiding van wijzigingen in pakketroutes. Je begeleidt de implementatie van nieuwe logicaschema’s door IT. Samen met stakeholders vanuit Operations en Sales breng je nieuwe netwerken in kaart en zorg je ervoor dat deze goed worden geïntegreerd in onze rapportages.


Je rapporteert de informatie die is opgeslagen op het DHL-dataplatform via Microsoft Power BI. Bij complexe vraagstukken bied je ondersteuning en advies en voer je analyses uit in Power BI of Excel om de efficiëntie van onze operaties te verbeteren. Jouw inzichten maken het verschil in onze logistieke processen!


Jouw nieuwe werkplek

Je komt te werken op het hoofdkantoor van DHL e-Commerce in Utrecht. Hier maak je deel uit van een jong en dynamisch team van Data Analysts binnen ons Operations-team. We stimuleren samenwerking en innovatie en luisteren altijd naar jouw ideeën en feedback. Bij DHL e-Commerce hechten we veel waarde aan een inclusieve en ondersteunende werkcultuur, waar iedereen de kans krijgt om te groeien en zich te ontwikkelen.


Dit ben jij

Je hebt ervaring met Microsoft Power BI en Excel en beschikt over sterke analytische vaardigheden op hbo- of wo-niveau. Communicatieve vaardigheden zijn essentieel, omdat je regelmatig overleg hebt met stakeholders. Je bent probleemoplossend ingesteld en kunt goed samenwerken met IT-teams en andere afdelingen. Daarnaast ben je leergierig en bereid om nieuwe inzichten te verwerven om onze processen te verbeteren.


Dit krijg jij

  • Een salaris tussen de €3700 - €4000 bruto op basis van 40 uur, gebaseerd op je kennis en ervaring;
  • Reiskostenvergoeding van €0,23 per kilometer, met een maximum tot 30 km enkele reis;
  • Een goede pensioenregeling;
  • Standaard 23 vakantiedagen en 8% vakantiegeld;
  • Cao à la carte: een budget dat je kan inzetten voor extra vakantiedagen of salaris;
  • Een laptop en telefoon van de zaak;
  • Opleidings- en trainingsmogelijkheden vanaf dag één;
  • Mooie doorgroeikansen binnen de organisatie;
  • De mogelijkheid tot hybride werken.


De toekomst van bezorgen is geel-rood

DHL eCommerce is het meest toonaangevende logistiekbedrijf ter wereld. Dat klinkt misschien opschepperig, maar zo bedoelen we het niet: we zien het namelijk niet als een verdienste, maar als een verantwoordelijkheid. Dankzij onze positie kunnen we het verschil maken voor onze mensen, het milieu en de maatschappij. En dat blijkt: we zijn een Great Place to Work, Top Employer 2025 en helpen via DHL Cares ontzettend veel mensen die dat hard kunnen gebruiken – daar zijn we trots op!


Solliciteren?

Solliciteer dan nu met je cv en eventueel een motivatiebrief. Heb je vragen over de vacature of wil je meer informatie? Aarzel dan niet om contact op te nemen met Eva Hazes, Corporate Recruiter, via eva.hazes@dhl.com. We kijken ernaar uit om van je te horen!


Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Title: Data Analyst / Data Visualization Expert
Description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they are doing!

We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.

Data Analyst / Data Visualization Expert

6 month FTC

Location: Eindhoven (onsite 3 days per week)

Fractal is a strategic AI partner to Fortune 500 companies with a vision to power every human decision in the enterprise. Fractal is building a world where individual choices, freedom, and diversity are the greatest assets. An ecosystem where human imagination is at the heart of every decision. Where no possibility is written off, only challenged to get better. We believe that a true Fractalite is the one who empowers imagination with intelligence. Fractal has been featured as a Great Place to Work by The Economic Times in partnership with the Great Place to Work® Institute and recognized as a ‘Cool Vendor’ and a ‘Vendor to Watch’ by Gartner.

About The Role

As a Data Analyst / Data Visualization Expert you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets and creating compelling visuals that communicate insights effectively to various stakeholders. Your role will involve both rigorous data analysis and the design of clear, precise, and engaging visualizations.

Key Responsibilities


Conduct thorough data analysis to identify trends, correlations, and patterns within datasets.
Develop impactful data visualizations using tools such as QuickSight, QlikSense, Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Create dashboards and reports that effectively communicate data findings to technical and non-technical audiences.
Ensure data integrity and quality by continuously auditing and cleansing data.
Work alongside cross-departmental teams to integrate data-driven insights into business strategies.
Provide technical guidance on best practices for data visualization and data storytelling.
Stay informed about the latest trends and techniques in data visualization and analytics.



Qualifications


Bachelor's/Master degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in data analysis and data visualization.
Proficient in using data visualization tools such as QuickSight, QlikSense,Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Strong analytical skills and experience with analytics tools such as SQL, Python, or R.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to convey complex data insights in a simple and impactful way.
Demonstrated ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team environment.
Strong attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy.
Experience with dashboard design and data storytelling.
Preferred: Java engineering experience for data processing and system integration tasks.



If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

Not the right fit? Let us know you're interested in a future opportunity by clicking Introduce Yourself in the top-right corner of the page or create an account to set up email alerts as new job postings become available that meet your interest!
Show more
HTML:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they are doing!

We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.

Data Analyst / Data Visualization Expert

6 month FTC

Location: Eindhoven (onsite 3 days per week)

Fractal is a strategic AI partner to Fortune 500 companies with a vision to power every human decision in the enterprise. Fractal is building a world where individual choices, freedom, and diversity are the greatest assets. An ecosystem where human imagination is at the heart of every decision. Where no possibility is written off, only challenged to get better. We believe that a true Fractalite is the one who empowers imagination with intelligence. Fractal has been featured as a Great Place to Work by The Economic Times in partnership with the Great Place to Work® Institute and recognized as a ‘Cool Vendor’ and a ‘Vendor to Watch’ by Gartner.

About The Role

As a Data Analyst / Data Visualization Expert you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets and creating compelling visuals that communicate insights effectively to various stakeholders. Your role will involve both rigorous data analysis and the design of clear, precise, and engaging visualizations.

Key Responsibilities

  • Conduct thorough data analysis to identify trends, correlations, and patterns within datasets.
  • Develop impactful data visualizations using tools such as QuickSight, QlikSense, Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and translate them into actionable insights.
  • Create dashboards and reports that effectively communicate data findings to technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Ensure data integrity and quality by continuously auditing and cleansing data.
  • Work alongside cross-departmental teams to integrate data-driven insights into business strategies.
  • Provide technical guidance on best practices for data visualization and data storytelling.
  • Stay informed about the latest trends and techniques in data visualization and analytics.


Qualifications

  • Bachelor's/Master degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in data analysis and data visualization.
  • Proficient in using data visualization tools such as QuickSight, QlikSense,Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.
  • Strong analytical skills and experience with analytics tools such as SQL, Python, or R.
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to convey complex data insights in a simple and impactful way.
  • Demonstrated ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team environment.
  • Strong attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy.
  • Experience with dashboard design and data storytelling.
  • Preferred: Java engineering experience for data processing and system integration tasks.


If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

Not the right fit? Let us know you're interested in a future opportunity by clicking Introduce Yourself in the top-right corner of the page or create an account to set up email alerts as new job postings become available that meet your interest!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your Tasks

Role

At MediaMarkt, we believe in innovation, growth, and freedom. As a dynamic company, we want to offer our customers the best shopping experience by placing data at the center of our operations. If you are looking for a fast-changing environment where you can make immediate and big impact using business intelligence, reporting, statistical analysis and machine learning, then this job is for you! In our Data & Analytics team, we are looking for a Data Analyst. The role includes:


Create and maintain an information infrastructure to empower organizational teams with data-driven insights for optimizing processes and business decision-making.
Data Analysis and Modeling: Analyze large and complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Develop and implement predictive models and machine learning algorithms. Perform statistical analyses to support business decision-making.
Data Collection & Organization: Collaborate with internal teams and data engineers to identify relevant datasets, gather data from various sources (sales, inventory, customer feedback, market research, external providers), and develop & maintain a structured tables for easy access and analysis.
Data Visualization & Reporting: Create and maintain appealing reports and dashboards in Power BI to facilitate data-driven decision-making. Create compelling data visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders. Develop dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs). Present data insights in a clear and concise manner to non-technical audiences.
Data Products / Solutions: Develop scalable data products to address business challenges, achieve process optimization or improve decision making. Build and implement tools to enable business lines to maximize the value of insights and reports.
Requirements Gathering: Partner with organizational teams to understand their business needs and translate them into actionable data product/reporting proposals that scale across business lines and improve decision-making processes.
Collaboration and Support: Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their data needs, provide actionable insights and support data-driven decision-making across the organization. Support data scientists and data engineers with data analysis, dashboarding and visualizations
Research and Development: Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data analytics, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. Experiment with new tools, techniques, and methodologies to improve data analysis processes. Contribute to the development of best practices and standards for data science within the organization.
Technical support: provide (limited) technical support with settings in RELEX, PriceFx and/or or category management related systems


Your Profile

Requirements

You are a builder. You love to set-up new ways of working, data pipeline & data projects and to embed those in the daily operations of the team. You get energy from seeing your colleagues use data products & you are an eager learner. You understand that the customer is at the heart of all our operations and you enjoy working closely with other departments to support our customers. For the practical requirements, we also expect:


Master’s degree in Economics, Econometrics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or other relevant areas
2-3 years work experience as data analyst
English (must have), Dutch (Pro)
Experience with Python/R and SQL a must
Experience with PowerBI / Looker
Experience with GCP / Google BigQuery (Pro)
Experience data projects and project management


About Us

For us"Let's Go!"is not just a slogan, it is an attitude. We love technology and we want to excite. We have fun and want to inspire. We are number one in Benelux and Europe. We influence how people experience and use technology. We make the difference and are there for our customers, through all channels. Together with our 50.000 employees across Europe, we create the shopping experience of the future.

Our best solutions arise when diverse perspectives come together. Diversity is key to achieving our vision of becoming the Experience Champion in Consumer Electronics. We value diversity, promote equal opportunities, and foster inclusion—join our team!

Additional Benefits

Job Infos

Location: Rotterdam

Media Markt Hoofdkantoor

Department: HQ - IT

Entrylevel: Professional Level

Type of Employement: Full Time/Part Time

Working Hours: 40

Persona: Job Requisition HQ Employee

Recruiter: Stefan Romeijn

Recruiter: Karen van Vliet

Title: Analyst
Description:
Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today, our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity, and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change, helping clients initiate, navigate, and benefit from transformation. Optimism is our force multiplier, mitigating downside and maximizing opportunity. With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our +3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results; our optimism transforms outcomes.





Job Description



Collecting, analyzing, and structuring information to support projects.



Personal & professional growth



Works on personal growth and learns the intricacies of the profession and sector by being curious and showing interest
Shows ownership of tasks, asks for help/questions in time when stuck, and aligns expectations with the project team
Collaborates constructively with colleagues and stakeholders and demonstrates reliability

Client & quality



Supports (senior) consultants in successfully executing projects by:
Collecting information
Analyzing and making this information insightful
Preparing workshops

Sia’s growth



Commerce: Assists in developing commercial opportunities and proposals
Knowledge: Shares acquired knowledge internally

Portfolio: Stays informed about the services and projects delivered by Sia





Qualifications


You have completed your Master’s Degree
You have 0 to 2 years’ experience within a consultancy firm
Sectoral knowledge: Telecom & Tech / Financial Services / Automotive / Life Sciences
Outstanding collaborative team player and good communication skills
Analytical mind, exploring options and able to synthesize into conclusions
Dutch and English communication and presentation skills are mandatory

What do we offer?



Competitive salary with extra advantages: a company car or flexible mobility plan, a clear and structured yearly salary increase and bonuses
Training plan to develop yourself as an expert in your discipline
You have the opportunity to work from home, the client or from our offices in Amsterdam or Maastricht
Working in an international environment which creates opportunities to share knowledge and work together on international projects with colleagues all over the world


Additional Information



We are unable to provide a work permit for this position



Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs. 



Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Marktplaats in The Netherlands, and 2dehands and 2ememain in Belgium, are part of Adevinta: a global online classifieds specialist. The three brands are hosted on a multi-tenant platform, operated from our Amsterdam location, and are the top players in the classifieds space throughout the Benelux region.

We offer consumers the opportunity to trade their unwanted products and contribute to a greener, circular economy. We offer businesses - of all sizes, from the smallest hobbyist to the biggest brands in Benelux - a platform to showcase their goods and services online to over 11 million monthly unique users.

What You’ll Do & Who You Are

Welcome to Marktplaats!

About Marktplaats And 2dehands

Marktplaats in The Netherlands, and 2dehands and 2ememain in Belgium, are part of Adevinta: a global online classifieds specialist. The three brands are hosted on a multi-tenant platform, operated from our Amsterdam location, and are the top players in the classifieds space throughout the Benelux.

We offer consumers the opportunity to trade their unwanted products and contribute to a greener, circular economy. We offer businesses - of all sizes, from the smallest hobbyist to the biggest brands in Benelux - a platform to showcase their goods and services online to over 11 million monthly unique users.

About The Role

The Benelux Business Analytics team is responsible for business analytics for the Dutch and Belgian businesses of Adevinta. In this role of Business and Strategy Analyst, you will have a focus on supporting the advertising domain with financial forecasting, business case creation and strategic guidance through data. You will provide dashboarding and reporting as needed, as well as ad hoc questions. Though your primary focus will be in this department, we prioritize across the domains, so you will also contribute to our other departments like automotive or transactions.

You are a high-impact contributor with a strong analytical mindset and a track record of top performance. You bring strategic thinking to the design and evolution of data structures, proactively identify opportunities for automation and operational efficiency, and translate complex data into actionable insights. With excellent communication skills, you serve as a trusted partner to both technical teams and business stakeholders—bridging the gap between analysis, engineering, and decision-making.

Responsibilities


Support the advertising domain, specifically focusing on performance and optimization of bannering revenue, as well as the features that users can purchase.
Analyze data to get insights on trends, anomalies and opportunities and drive business decisions
Gather market insights and translate them into impactful initiatives for our business teams
Set-up, automate, maintain, and own dashboards and reporting structure for operational metrics and revenue streams of your focus area
Closely work together with the advertising business teams and finance teams to define the key operational and financial metrics
Construct and deliver clear, concise presentations of findings, key product and user performance metrics and management recommendations both in oral and written form


Qualifications


Professional experience of 4-6 years in the field
Academic degree, preferably in a quantitative field like mathematics, econometrics, statistics etc.
Expert with SQL, Tableau and Excel skills are a requirement. Experience with Python or similar is a plus
Proven experience in working with large, multisource data sets and usage of analytics to drive business and product decisions and strategy
The skill to explain complicated analyses in a simple way to colleagues and management
Ability to work in an agile and flexible environment where change is part of the day-to-day environment
The attitude to go that extra mile when needed and celebrate success after achievements


Benefits

Life at Adevinta comes with its perks! Our Adevintans enjoy the following benefits:


An attractive Base Salary 💸
Participation in our Short Term Incentive plan (annual bonus) 🏆
Work From Anywhere: Enjoy up to 20 days a year of working from anywhere! Maybe not from the moon🌛well why not! just make sure you have internet connection! 🌍
A 24/7 Employee Assistance Program for you and your family, because we care ❤️
Win together, lose together is one of our key behaviours. At Adevinta you will find a collaborative environment with an opportunity to explore your potential and grow 🌱


On top of these, we also provide a range of locally relevant benefits. Wanna know more? Apply and ask our recruiters! ✨

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.
Show more

  • A 24/7 Employee Assistance Program for you and your family, because we care ❤️
  • Win together, lose together is one of our key behaviours. At Adevinta you will find a collaborative environment with an opportunity to explore your potential and grow 🌱

On top of these, we also provide a range of locally relevant benefits. Wanna know more? Apply and ask our recruiters! ✨

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Why work at Nebius

Nebius is leading a new era in cloud computing to serve the global AI economy. We create the tools and resources our customers need to solve real-world challenges and transform industries, without massive infrastructure costs or the need to build large in-house AI/ML teams. Our employees work at the cutting edge of AI cloud infrastructure alongside some of the most experienced and innovative leaders and engineers in the field.




Where we work

Headquartered in Amsterdam and listed on Nasdaq, Nebius has a global footprint with R&D hubs across Europe, North America, and Israel. The team of over 800 employees includes more than 400 highly skilled engineers with deep expertise across hardware and software engineering, as well as an in-house AI R&D team.




Role Overview:

As a Data Analyst at our company, you will play a key role in shaping our product strategy and transforming raw data into actionable insights. We are an AI cloud provider offering GPU capacity, PaaS services, and SaaS APIs for ML models, with rapid growth anticipated in both our B2B and B2C markets. Your expertise will empower us to better understand customer behavior, optimize digital traffic for our marketing team, and enhance overall marketing performance.




Key Responsibilities:




Analyzing Data & Uncovering Insights:

Data Exploration: Dive into large datasets to identify patterns and trends in user behavior, marketing performance, and platform interactions.
Ownership: Take full responsibility for analytical solutions while collaborating closely with the UX and Marketing teams.




End-to-End Analytics:

Data Solutions: Build robust data solutions—from developing data pipelines to creating dashboards—that drive data-informed decision-making.
SQL & Workflow Optimization: Write efficient SQL queries and optimize data workflows using ClickHouse, Spark, TractoAI (based on the YTSaurus database), or similar systems
Data Visualization: Leverage BI tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar) to design clear and compelling visualizations.




Cross-Functional Collaboration:

Teamwork: Work closely with teams across the organization to define analytical requirements and deliver strategic insights.
Prioritization: Prioritize analytical research projects based on their potential impact on customer experience.
Reporting: Explain and support existing analytical reports.




Tools Implementation:

Innovation: Experiment with new tools and technologies to drive innovative analytics solutions that meet business requirements in terms of performance, scalability, and data quality.




Key Qualifications & Experience:

Experience: 4+ years in a Data Analyst, Data Engineer, or a similar role.
Technical Proficiency:
Strong SQL skills.Proficiency in Python for data processing and automation.
Hands-on experience with ETL/ELT pipelines and data transformation workflows.
Familiarity with BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, or similar) for creating impactful dashboards.
Experience with Git for version control and Docker for container management.
Analytical Skills:
Ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and tell a compelling story.
Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills for effective collaboration with cross-functional teams.
Work Style: A structured, independent approach to solving data challenges.
Educational Background: A background in Mathematics and Economics is an advantage.




Preferred qualifications:

Experience with marketing and UX analytics.
Experience with Google Analytics or similar products.
Knowledge of A/B testing, customer segmentation, and behavior analysis.




Why Join Us?




Shape the Future: Be at the forefront of AI-driven cloud analytics in a fast-growing company.
End-to-End Ownership: Manage the full analytics process from data ingestion to insights.
Impact: See your work drive strategic decisions and fuel business growth across both B2B and B2C markets.
Innovative Culture: Join a collaborative, data-driven team that values innovation and professional development.
Show more

Why Join Us?


  • Shape the Future: Be at the forefront of AI-driven cloud analytics in a fast-growing company.
  • End-to-End Ownership: Manage the full analytics process from data ingestion to insights.
  • Impact: See your work drive strategic decisions and fuel business growth across both B2B and B2C markets.
  • Innovative Culture: Join a collaborative, data-driven team that values innovation and professional development.

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Data Analist




Voor een wereldwijd toonaangevende financiële klant in Nederland ben ik met spoed op zoek naar een Data Analist.

Taken en werkzaamheden

Tijdig en accuraat aanleveren van data op basis van ad-hoc verzoeken.
Uitvoeren van data-analyses en vertalen van inzichten naar concrete adviezen.
Stakeholders ondersteunen met jouw data-expertise en bijdragen aan het verhogen van data literacy binnen de Tribe.
Ondersteunen bij migratie naar het nieuwe platform (datasets aanvragen, queries ombouwen).




Jouw profiel:

Je bent een bruggenbouwer tussen business en data, dus we zoeken een business profiel met technische vaardigheden (tov puur tech profiel).
Je kunt complexe data vertalen naar informatie en uitleggen aan een stakeholder.
Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring met:
Data analyse en het opstellen van adviezen
SQL en Databricks (minimaal 3 jaar intensief mee gewerkt)
Flexibel kunnen schakelen tussen verschillende verzoeken en prioriteiten.
Omdat we een klein team zijn, zoeken we een kandidaat die niet alleen goed kan samenwerken, maar ook actief wil bijdragen aan de teamdynamiek en zich echt onderdeel wil voelen van het team.
Master of bachelor degree (bijv. data analytics /econometrie / wiskunde / bedrijfskunde met specialisatie data-analyse / statistiek)
Nederlands en Engels sprekend
Ervaring binnen een bank of financiële instelling, bij voorkeur ervaring binnen het zakelijk domein




Mocht jij de Data Analist zijn waar mijn klant naar op zoek is, aarzel dan niet om je c.v. aan mij te sturen!




Contract: 6+ months

Tarief: Uitstekend

Locatie: Amsterdam (Hybrid)




Nick Chinweerapunt

Account Manager

Gazelle Global Consulting

Tel +31 85 111 0171

Tel +44 203 588 7747

Mob +44 7377 403 773

nick@gazellegc.com

Title: Junior Data-analist
Description:
Geodata Beheerder / Data Analist – Lokale overheid




Ben jij analytisch sterk, technisch vaardig en zie jij data als dé sleutel tot slimme oplossingen in de publieke sector? Voor meerdere gemeentes zowel binnen als buiten de randstad zoekt The Trainee Company data talent die aan de slag willen als Junior Geodata Beheerder / Data Analist die klaar is om impact te maken met geografische informatie.




Wat kan je verwachten?

Als Geodata Beheerder / Data Analist werk je binnen een team van analisten aan het beheren én verrijken van geografische data binnen de wettelijke basisregistraties zoals BAG, BGT en BOR. Je zorgt dat data klopt, structuur krijgt én inzichten geeft voor beleidsmakers, bewoners en collega’s.

Je pakt zelfstandig projecten op waarin je data niet alleen beheert en analyseert, maar ook visueel maakt via dashboards door middel van het gebruik van bijvoorbeeld Power BI of Tableau.

Voorbeelden van projecten zijn: Het in kaart brengen van Parken & speeltuinen ten opzichte van het aantal huishoudens binnen een gemeente, een goed overzicht maken van verkeerspleinen/kruispunten in combinatie met gemelde ongevallen of het aantal parkeerplaatsen per wijk in kaart brengen ten opzichte van het aantal voertuigen die aldaar op naam van inwoners staan.

Je leert naast dit alles ook te werken met Geografische informatiesystemen al QGIS of ArcGis en denkt actief mee over hoe geografische data waarde kan toevoegen aan de stad en keuzes voor naar de toekomst toe.




Dit bieden wij jou

Een flitsende start van jouw carrière in Data & Analytics
Bij ons draait alles om jouw persoonlijke groei. We staan je met één-op-één begeleiding bij gedurende het hele traject
Een startsalaris tussen de €2600-€2800 dat past bij jouw ervaringsniveau
Na een jaar bieden we je, op basis van een evaluatieproces, de kans op een salarisverhoging tot maximaal €500 bruto, als erkenning voor je groei en prestaties
Talloze interessante trainingen, masterclasses en de mogelijkheid om waardevolle certificaten te behalen op het gebied van data, projectmatig werken en procesoptimalisatie.
25 Vakantiedagen, vakantiegeld en reiskostenvergoeding op maat
Work hard, play hard! Met leuke borrels, toffe teamuitjes en evenementen houden we het teamgevoel hoog!




Dit vragen wij van jou

Een afgeronde hbo-of wo-opleiding in een technische, geografische of data-gerelateerde richting
Een vlotte babbel, oplossingsgerichtheid en professionaliteit
Een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal
Ervaring met kaartviewers en affiniteit met datavisualisatie
Ervaring met QGIS of ArcGIS is een pré
Ervaring met (of interesse in) Power BI, Tableau of vergelijkbare dashboarding tools
Basiskennis van BAG, BGT en BOR is een pré
Show more

Title: Analyst - Data Science
Description:
Who We Are

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering Big Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


Interact with our clients on regular basis, to drive their business towards impactful change.
Work in multidisciplinary teams and learn from motivated colleagues.
A chance to take responsibility for your work, develop yourself every day and take full ownership of your career.
Become part of a fast growing international and diverse team.



What You Will Do


Perform data analysis in the field of Growth Revenue Management, Marketing Analytics, CLM/CRM Analytics and/or Risk Analytics.
Conduct analyses in typical analytical tools ranging from SAS, SPSS, Eviews, R, Python, SQL, Teradata, Hadoop, Access, Excel, etc.
Communicate analyses via compelling presentations.
Solve problems, disaggregate issues, develop hypotheses and develop actionable recommendations from data and analysis
Prepare and facilitating workshops
Manage stakeholders and communicating with executives
Coach and mentor team members



What You Will Bring


1-3 years of professional experience in the analytics domain.
An advanced degree in quantitative field (e.g. Engineering, Mathematics, etc.).
An ability to think analytically, decompose problem sets, develop hypotheses and recommendations from data analysis.
Strong technical skills regarding data analysis, statistics, and programming. Strong working knowledge of SQL, Python, R, and/or Matlab.
Ability to talk the language of statistics, finance, and economics.
Profound knowledge of the English language.



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.
Show more

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Wil jij met jouw analytische vaardigheden bijdragen aan betere zorg, onderwijs en overheidsdiensten? Bij Van Dam Datapartners zoeken we een Data Analist die data omzet in heldere inzichten en concrete adviezen.




Wat ga je doen?

Analyseren & inzicht bieden: je onderzoekt datasets van gemeenten, zorginstellingen en andere publieke organisaties om maatschappelijke trends en knelpunten te signaleren.
Datavisualisatie & rapportages: je bouwt dashboards en rapportages in tools zoals Power BI, Tableau, Qlik of Cognos, zodat besluitvormers direct aan de slag kunnen met jouw inzichten.
Adviseren & presenteren: je vertaalt data naar duidelijke en overtuigende adviezen en presenteert deze aan opdrachtgevers.
Samenwerken & verbeteren: je werkt in een dynamisch team, waarbij je samen met Data Engineers en BI-specialisten slimme data-oplossingen ontwikkelt.

Projecten met maatschappelijke impact en opdrachten die ertoe doen. Uitstekende ontwikkelmogelijkheden, zowel inhoudelijk als persoonlijk. Werken in een bedrijf waar je vrijheid krijgt, maar ook verantwoordelijkheid draagt.




Wie ben jij?

HBO/WO niveau opgeleid
Je hebt minimaal 1 jaar ervaring binnen het publieke domein.
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met het analyseren van data.
Kennis van datavisualisatie, statistiek en SQL.
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden: je kunt complexe analyses eenvoudig uitleggen.
Je houdt van een uitdaging en voelt je thuis in een dynamische commerciële omgeving.
Je bent proactief en neemt het initiatief om met klanten in gesprek te gaan, zowel op inhoud als op de relatie. Je signaleert kansen en zoekt samen naar de beste oplossingen.




Uiteraard staat deze vacature open voor iedereen die zich hierin herkent. We geloven dat diversiteit binnen onze teams zorgt voor groei en innovatie.




Wat bieden we jou?

Werken in een organisatie met maatschappelijke relevantie, maar ook met ruimte voor jouw ontwikkeling.
Een marktconform salaris (€ 3.750 – € 5.500 per maand, op basis van 40 uur per week), afhankelijk van ervaring.
8% vakantiegeld.
NS-Business Card of reiskostenvergoeding (€ 0,23/km).
Een laptop en telefoon.
25 vakantiedagen.
De mogelijkheid om 5 extra dagen te kopen of verkopen.
Pensioenregeling bij Nationale Nederlanden.
Thuiswerkvergoeding van € 2,40 per dag + vergoeding voor inrichting thuiswerkplek.
Toegang tot onze Academy voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Company: SDG Group in the Netherlands – A Division of Alten NL
Place: Capelle aan den IJssel, South Holland, Netherlands
Description:
Data Analyst – Capelle a/d IJssel - ALTEN Nederland




De functie

Als onderdeel van ons groeiend bedrijf zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Analyst om ons team te versterken en bij te dragen aan lopende klantprojecten in Capelle a/d IJssel.




Als Data Analyst omvatten je belangrijkste taken:

Analyseren, interpreteren en visualiseren van complexe datasets
Meedenken met klanten over data-gedreven verbeteringen en oplossingen
Ontwerpen van dashboards en rapportages met tools zoals Power BI of Tableau
Vertalen van businessvraagstukken naar concrete data-analyses (SQL, Python, R)
Samenwerken met multidisciplinaire teams (developers, engineers, consultants)
Bijdragen aan projecten van data-acquisitie tot presentatie en advies




Jouw profiel

Minimaal een hbo- of wo-diploma in een relevante richting (bijv. Data Science, Informatica, Econometrie)
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke functie als Data Analyst of BI Consultant
Vaardig in SQL, Power BI, Tableau en kennis van Python en/of R
Vloeiend in Nederlands en Engels
Gewenste soft skills: analytisch denkvermogen, probleemoplossend, communicatief sterk, klantgericht en proactief




Arbeidsvoorwaarden

Je krijgt een vast contract
Je krijgt een leaseauto met tankpas
Mogelijkheid tot hybride werken
Maandelijkse netto onkostenvergoeding
27 vakantiedagen met de mogelijkheid om 10 extra dagen bij te kopen
Pensioenregeling zonder eigen bijdrage




Waarom kiezen voor ALTEN?

Impactvolle projecten in belangrijke sectoren: Draag bij aan betekenisvolle initiatieven in sectoren zoals defensie, transport, telecom en financiën, waar jouw expertise echt het verschil maakt.
Een breed klantenportfolio: Werk samen met zowel grote marktleiders als innovatieve middelgrote bedrijven en verzamel zo diverse en verrijkende ervaringen.
Versterk je loopbaan dankzij SDG's expertise: Bij ALTEN staat jouw ontwikkeling centraal. Je krijgt toegang tot doorlopende leermogelijkheden via trainingen, technische communities en evenementen. Sinds 2020 is dit verder versterkt door de integratie van SDG, erkend als pionier in Data-, Analytics- & AI-consultancy en als leider in complexe systemen en embedded technologieën.
Een cultuur van innovatie en samenwerking: Ontplooi je in een omgeving die creativiteit waardeert, kennisdeling aanmoedigt en gezamenlijk succes stimuleert.




Over ALTEN

ALTEN is een wereldwijde leider in engineering- en technologieconsultancy, en ondersteunt topklanten in hun innovatie- en R&D-strategieën. Met meer dan 57.000 medewerkers in meer dan 30 landen zijn we actief in sectoren zoals lucht- en ruimtevaart, automotive, telecom, financiën, energie en life sciences.




ALTEN Netherlands is een belangrijke entiteit binnen de ALTEN Group, met kantoren in Eindhoven, Capelle aan den IJssel, Apeldoorn, Groningen en Amstelveen. Onze 550+ consultants leveren hoogwaardige oplossingen in technologie en IT. Al meer dan 20 jaar dragen we in Nederland bij aan impactvolle projecten in hightech, defensie, transport, telecom en financiën, en ondersteunen we bedrijven in hun technologische transformatie.




Een belangrijke stap in onze ontwikkeling was de overname van SDG, erkend als pionier in Data, Analytics & AI-consultancy en expert in complexe systeemengineering. Deze strategische stap heeft onze technische expertise vergroot en ons aanbod van geavanceerde oplossingen verbreed. Door de integratie van SDG’s kennis kunnen we innovatieve oplossingen bieden die extra waarde creëren voor zowel onze klanten als consultants, in Nederland en daarbuiten.




Klaar voor jouw volgende uitdaging?

Solliciteer nu en neem deel aan boeiende en impactvolle projecten bij ALTEN Nederland!

Show more

ALTEN is een wereldwijde leider in engineering- en technologieconsultancy, en ondersteunt topklanten in hun innovatie- en R&D-strategieën. Met meer dan 57.000 medewerkers in meer dan 30 landen zijn we actief in sectoren zoals lucht- en ruimtevaart, automotive, telecom, financiën, energie en life sciences.


ALTEN Netherlands is een belangrijke entiteit binnen de ALTEN Group, met kantoren in Eindhoven, Capelle aan den IJssel, Apeldoorn, Groningen en Amstelveen. Onze 550+ consultants leveren hoogwaardige oplossingen in technologie en IT. Al meer dan 20 jaar dragen we in Nederland bij aan impactvolle projecten in hightech, defensie, transport, telecom en financiën, en ondersteunen we bedrijven in hun technologische transformatie.


Een belangrijke stap in onze ontwikkeling was de overname van SDG, erkend als pionier in Data, Analytics & AI-consultancy en expert in complexe systeemengineering. Deze strategische stap heeft onze technische expertise vergroot en ons aanbod van geavanceerde oplossingen verbreed. Door de integratie van SDG’s kennis kunnen we innovatieve oplossingen bieden die extra waarde creëren voor zowel onze klanten als consultants, in Nederland en daarbuiten.


Klaar voor jouw volgende uitdaging?

Solliciteer nu en neem deel aan boeiende en impactvolle projecten bij ALTEN Nederland!

Title: Analyst
Description:
Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today, our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity, and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change, helping clients initiate, navigate, and benefit from transformation. Optimism is our force multiplier, mitigating downside and maximizing opportunity. With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our +3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results; our optimism transforms outcomes.





Job Description



Collecting, analyzing, and structuring information to support projects.



Personal & professional growth



Works on personal growth and learns the intricacies of the profession and sector by being curious and showing interest
Shows ownership of tasks, asks for help/questions in time when stuck, and aligns expectations with the project team
Collaborates constructively with colleagues and stakeholders and demonstrates reliability

Client & quality



Supports (senior) consultants in successfully executing projects by:
Collecting information
Analyzing and making this information insightful
Preparing workshops

Sia’s growth



Commercially: Assists in developing commercial opportunities and proposals
Knowledge: Shares acquired knowledge internally

Portfolio: Stays informed about the services and projects delivered by Sia





Qualifications


You have completed your Master’s Degree
You have 0 to 2 years’ experience within a consultancy firm
Sectoral knowledge: Telecom & Tech / Financial Services / Automotive / Life Sciences
Outstanding collaborative team player and good communication skills
Analytical mind, exploring options and able to synthesize into conclusions
Dutch and English communication and presentation skills are mandatory

What do we offer?



Competitive salary with extra advantages: a company car or flexible mobility plan, a clear and structured yearly salary increase and bonuses
Training plan to develop yourself as an expert in your discipline
You have the opportunity to work from home, the client or from our inspiring office in Amsterdam or Maastricht
Working in an international environment which creates opportunities to share knowledge and work together on international projects with colleagues all over the world


Additional Information



We are unable to provide a work permit for this position



Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs. 



Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Title: DIGITAL DATA ANALYST (M/F/D)
Description:
We are a community open to everyone. One global team where everyone counts.

Join the Canyon team and work at the cutting edge of the bike industry, with a job as versatile and exciting as the bikes we develop. All in an open, international atmosphere where teamwork, collaboration, true innovation, and a dynamic workplace are all part of our everyday. Ready to ride with us?

THE ROLE

Canyon is a digital-first, direct-to-consumer brand – and data is at the heart of how we grow, optimise, and innovate. As a Digital Data Analyst, you'll combine business acumen with deep technical expertise to generate robust analytics, scalable reporting, and actionable insight. You’ll work across Digital, Marketing, Sales, and BI to build analytical products, engineer efficient data pipelines, and enable decision-making at speed and scale.

YOUR JOB AS PART OF THE CANYON CREW


Partner with business stakeholders to scope analytical use cases and deliver structured, data-driven solutions
Analyse KPIs spanning e-commerce performance, customer journeys, traffic acquisition, conversion, and product engagement
Build robust dashboards and scalable reporting tools using data from GA4, CRM, ERP, and marketing platforms
Convey data-driven insights and business recommendations through clear and actionable presentations, up to C-level audience
Develop and maintain performant cloud-based data pipelines to enable reliable access to clean, transformed datasets
Integrate external and internal APIs to enrich existing data sources and improve attribution, segmentation, and targeting
Perform advanced data wrangling, SQL scripting, and transformation tasks across large, complex datasets
Apply statistical techniques and modelling to identify trends, forecast outcomes, and support optimisation initiatives
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through validation rules, QA processes, and source-to-report consistency checks
Collaborate with Data Engineers and Scientists to evolve our tooling and infrastructure
Evolve into advanced analytics / data science topics (e.g., predictive modelling, experimentation, ML enablement)


How You Become Part Of The Race


Master’s degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a closely related technical field; please attach diploma
:3–5 years of experience in analytics-heavy roles (e.g. Consultant, Data Analyst, …) with direct technical ownership; please attach references if available
Expert-level SQL and comfort working with cloud platforms (e.g. BigQuery, GCP)
Proficiency in Python or R for scripting, modelling, or data transformation
Experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, Power BI) and web analytics (GA4, Adobe, etc.)
Strong understanding of data structures, ETL concepts, and data integration workflows
Sharp analytical thinking, structured problem solving, and a bias for clean, repeatable solutions


HIGHLIGHTS ON YOUR CANYON TOUR

The Canyon Crew 

In our global team, we combine energy and transparency and promote a feedback culture as well as Canyon events, along with inspiring crew rides. Welcome to a career that is more than just a job! 

Feel Canyon  

Unlock your passion for cycling with us! Enjoy exclusive discounts on bikes, gear, and apparel as part of our commitment to fueling your cycling journey. 

Compensation 

Experience a rewarding career with a competitive market-based salary, generous paid time off and we contribute to your private pension scheme as we care for your future. Your satisfaction is our priority as we build a thriving work environment together. 

Working Model 

Join us for a career that prioritizes life-work integration through flexible and hybrid work options. Experience a family-friendly environment where balance is not just a goal but a way of professional life. 

Working Culture 

Be part of our journey in creating an inclusive workplace where your voice matters. Your well-being is our highest priority and together with you we unlock the Canyon spirit. 

Job Variety 

Explore a diverse career path with us, where you can delve into various departments with operational, strategic, creative, or technical roles. Experience a wide range of job opportunities that consistently challenge and inspire you.  

Impact 

Embark on a career shaping the future of mobility in a global environment. Join us as we prioritize innovation, fun and sustainability, always putting our customers first, with the shared goal of building the best bikes for a forward-thinking world.

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
Ahoy, Dataofficier!


Krijg jij energie van het bouwen van dashboards die wel gebruikt worden, rapportages waar mensen echt wat mee doen en vind je het leuk om verbeteringsadviezen te geven? Dan hebben wij een schip vol data klaarstaan, en jij mag aan het roer staan.
Voor een technische organisatie die werkt aan alles van superjachten tot onderzeeërs zoeken we een BI Analyst die het verhaal achter de cijfers snapt én vertelt. Ieder project is uniek, complex en innovatief. Data speelt daarin een steeds grotere rol, en jij gaat zorgen dat die data ook echt voor ons werkt.



Wat ga je doen?


Je vertaalt onderhoudsdata, feedback en prestaties naar slimme rapportages.
Je bouwt dashboards die meteen duidelijk maken wat er speelt.
Je zorgt dat data uit onze systemen soepel en netjes in het datawarehouse belandt.
Je schakelt veel met collega's, ICT en onze data engineers om alles kloppend én bruikbaar te maken.


Wat je daarvoor nodig hebt:


Een hbo-diploma in een technische of bedrijfskundige richting.
Minstens 2 jaar ervaring in een vergelijkbare BI-rol.
Skills in Power BI (of Metabase/Cognos BI/TM1), SQL en datamodellering.
Kennis van ETL/ELT-processen (Airflow/Python = pré).
Je bent in het bezit van een NATO-nationaliteit en kunt een VGB aanvragen.
Je spreekt en schrijft goed Nederlands en Engels.


Wat je ervoor terugkrijgt:


Een salaris tussen €3.900 en €5.400 bruto per maand.
8% vakantiegeld, 4% vaste gratificatie én een winstdelingsregeling.
25 vakantiedagen + 13 ADV-dagen.
Laptop, telefoon, flexibele werktijden en hybride werken.
Een goede pensioenregeling.


Klinkt dit als jouw volgende data avontuur? Stuur me een berichtje of reageer direct, dan vertel ik je alles over deze rol.
