Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Froda is on a mission to revolutionize SME financing by leveraging data, AI, and machine learning to create intelligent, scalable, and efficient financing solutions. As we expand across Europe, we're focused on building cutting-edge credit risk models, fraud detection systems, and automation processes that empower small businesses to thrive.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our growing team and play a key role in shaping the infrastructure and workflows that power data, machine learning, and analytics at Froda.

About The Role

To power our growing ambitions, we are expanding our data & ML capabilities. As a Data Engineer at Froda, you’ll play a key role in designing, building and maintaining the infrastructure and workflows that enable machine learning, analytics, and data products across the company.

You’ll work closely with data scientists, analysts, and other data and analytics stakeholders to create scalable, production-ready pipelines and platforms that drive real business impact — from credit risk and fraud detection to business automation and decision-making.

Together with the rest of the team, you’ll continuously deliver value while improving technical structure and ensuring the reliability and scalability of our systems.

Who are you?

We believe that you are a systems-oriented engineer who is passionate about enabling machine learning and analytics at scale. You’re curious, analytical, and love turning complex problems into robust technical solutions. You enjoy collaborating across teams, sharing knowledge, and contributing to a data-first culture.

Your Experience:


3 to 5+ years in a similar role, ideally within tech- and product-driven companies
Designing and building robust data pipelines in production environments
Working with cloud-based data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake) and streaming platforms (e.g., Kafka)
Building and maintaining ML-Ops platforms or similar infrastructures
Working with Python, SQL, and orchestration tools like Airflow or DBT
Using Docker and Kubernetes, and deploying models via APIs (e.g., FastAPI, KServe)
Cloud platforms such as Azure or similar
Feature stores and reusable ML pipelines (strong plus)


As Swedish is our primary working language, we’re looking for someone who’s fluent in both Swedish and English.

What’s in it for you?

At Froda, you’ll be part of a company that combines the best of both worlds – a fast-moving, high-energy culture with the stability and structure to support long-term success. We’re 100+ ambitious self-starters who genuinely care for each other and the work we do, all while having fun together.

Here, you’ll have the opportunity to take ownership of your work, develop your skills, and shape your own growth journey. With big ambitions and a rapidly evolving business, there’s plenty of room to grow, lead initiatives, and make a real impact on both our company and the industry. If you're looking to be part of a success story and contribute to something bigger, this is the place for you.

Furthermore, you’ll get:


An opportunity to be part of an exciting journey, shaping the future of our company and transforming the SME financing landscape
Fabulous office overlooking Stockholm and a friendly culture that values work/life balance
We prioritize working in the office to maximize the positive impact of in-person collaboration, but we offer flexibility with work hours and remote work
Competitive compensation package
Insurance and pension plan


If you're excited by our mission of building the tech that powers funding for thousands of entrepreneurs, apply or tell a friend!
Show more

Title: Expert Data Scientist
Description:
Job ID: 27380

Are you ready to help shape the future of ML & AI at Scandinavia’s largest bank, working alongside a dynamic, fast-paced team? The Group AI Center of Excellence is an established unit within Group Technology focusing on delivering and enabling ML/AI use cases across the organization. The unit provides reusable ML/AI Assets that are developed in conjunction with business stakeholders to be leveraged by a wide variety of use cases.

We are now looking for an Expert Data Scientist who is interested in working in the field of ML/AI with use-cases across the bank. You will work closely with data scientists, ML engineers, and business stakeholders to take AI applications from concept to production, ensuring they are developed in an ethical, safe, and sustainable way.

About This Opportunity

Welcome to the Data science & Decisioning team. Your passion for working with people from both a technical and a business background, coupled with your curiosity for ML & AI and new innovations like Generative AI, makes you well-suited for this position. As Nordea pioneers its way into an ML/AI and Gen AI driven future, you will thrive by embracing a dynamic environment, fostering collaboration, and maintaining an open and adaptable mindset.

What you will be doing:


As a data scientist, you will help to resolve data-intensive decisioning problems through application of data processing & modelling and contribute to driving intelligent automation through algorithmic & model-based solutions:
Design and build scalable, reliable ML/AI solutions, using existing assets & framework or creating something new from scratch
Collaborate and engage in discussions with stakeholders and colleagues related to requirements, data and methods for data manipulation to resolve broad spectrum of business problems
Ensure our ML/AI applications are developed from idea to production, meeting all necessary requirements for smooth and successful deployment
Engage and incorporate feedbacks by following the internal guidelines coming from model risk validation framework, legal or privacy teams. Engage in optimizing the code for further steps towards model deployment
Stay on top of cutting-edge technologies by exploring and recommending the latest and greatest AI methods, tools and services. Your insights will keep us ahead of the curve!

Our AI team culture is built on collaboration, continuous learning and innovation. We foster an open environment where diverse ideas thrive, encouraging everyone to push the boundaries of technology while supporting each other's growth. With a strong focus on well-being, we prioritize work-life balance and encourage open communication.

At Nordea, inclusion and diversity are at the heart of our values. We believe that a diverse workforce drives innovation, fosters creativity and creates a more supportive workplace for all. The role is based in Høje Taastrup, Helsinki, or Stockholm.

Who You Are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:


Embrace a growth mindset, where you enjoy taking initiative and bringing solutions
Enjoy problem solving, and tackling challenges
Are an awesome team member and you have a strong ability to inspire and collaborate with people to take action


Your experience and background:


BSc, MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Engineering Physics, relevant data science field
10+ years of experience in testing, maintaining, launching AI/ML products, working with MLOps best practices and DevOps environment (CI/CD pipelines, Docker, container orchestration)
Experience in training, evaluation, fine-tuning and deployment of predictive models; including feature selection, hyper-parameter tuning, error analysis and data visualisation
You’re a coding wizard in one or more data science programming language i.e. Python, Pyspark, SQL etc., and you know your ways around tools like IBM Watson (CP4D), BitBucket, Hive, Unix Systems, visualization tool such as PowerBI etc.
Experience working with public cloud providers (AWS, Azure or GCP), especially their serverless, ML (e.g., AWS SageMaker), or data storage services as well as Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
Skilled at transforming complex ideas into clear, engaging explanations—whether you're presenting to a technical team or breaking things down for non-experts


If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

We kindly ask you to submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than 17/08/2025. We will ongoingly be reviewing applications and conducting interviews as we receive them, and might close the recruitment process before the posting end date. Any applications or CVs sent by email, direct messages, or any other channel than our application forms, will not be accepted or considered.

If you have any questions about the role or this recruitment process, please reach out to our tech recruiter and main point of contact Anna Dahlström, anna.dahlstrom@consult.nordea.com.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Only for candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer Insight
Description:
Data Engineer

Do you want to build the next datamodels för AI, ML and datawarehouse empowered solutions?

Nexer Insight, a Microsoft partner, invites you to embark on a journey as a Data Engineer where you'll be part of an extraordinary team, engage in exciting activities, work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits. We are committed to leveraging cutting-edge technologies such as Databricks to drive innovation and excellence in everything we do.

Do you want to be our next ”Data Ninja”?

Joining Nexer Insight means becoming a vital part of a company that embodies entrepreneurship and innovation. Here, you'll have the chance to engage with cutting-edge technology from Microsoft, Databricks, and DBT Labs, as we proudly partner with them. We're committed to investing in our employees, empowering them to excel in their fields through professional growth and development opportunities. Collaboration is at the heart of our approach, as we value teamwork and foster a vibrant community spirit. Dive into the exciting intersection of data engineering and data science, where you'll have the chance to make a meaningful impact.

Key Responsibilities:


Develop and operate scalable and robust analytical models.
Set up data platforms and build data models and pipelines.
Innovate and collaborate with customers to learn and find new business opportunities.
Become a champion in best practices regarding architecture, data quality, reliability, and performance.
Be at the forefront of the latest data engineering technology.
Leveraging Microsoft Azure services for data processing, transformation, and storage.
You propel progress and ensure delivery by constructing top-tier cloud solutions, empowering our customers to adopt a data-driven approach.



Based on our criteria för the role, we expect you to have:


Hands-on project experience of working with cloud solutions (Azure, AWS or GCP)
Experience working with ETL tools such as Azure Data Factory, Databricks, DBT, Snowflake
Experience with Data Lakes or Lakehouse Architecture
In-depth knowledge of SQL syntax
Experience in information and dimensional modelling
Good knowledge of DevOps processes with git version control and CI/CD methodology
Speaks English and Swedish fluently



Meritorious experience:


Platform modernisation
Tabular cubes and DAX
Data Vault modelling
Experience in setting up Azure, AWS or GCP Infrastructure
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Turn data into insights that drive smarter decisions across a global organization

Are you passionate about transforming data into business value? Join our Global IT team and help shape how BioMar uses data to inform decisions and drive strategic progress across our global organization. Your work will bring clarity to complex questions and help colleagues make better decisions every day.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our journey toward becoming a more data-driven organization. You’ll play a key role in unlocking the full potential of our BI platform, BioMetrics, built on Microsoft Azure and using Tableau for reporting and visualization. BioMetrics connects people with the data they need to move the business forward.

At BioMar, the role of Data Analyst is titled IT Solution Lead, and this will be your official title once you join us.

Make a difference in how we turn business questions into actionable answers

In this role, your focus will be on delivering the right data in clear, interactive dashboards and reports that bring business matters into sharp focus. By designing BI solutions that are not just informative but truly actionable, you’ll help colleagues quickly grasp key insights and take the right steps to move the business forward.


Partner with colleagues across the business to understand and translate their needs into data requirements
Design and maintain insightful dashboards, reports, and visualizations using Tableau or similar tools
Use strong problem-solving skills to work through complex business challenges and data
Improve reporting processes and ensure data quality across our BI platform
Align BI products with strategic goals and business value


Bring your experience and curiosity to build better data solutions

You are someone who thrives in complexity, takes ownership, and enjoys working closely with diverse colleagues. You know that successful BI is about more than just numbers - it’s about making things easier to understand, easier to act on, and more impactful. You are proactive, structured, and committed to continuous improvement.


At least 5 years of experience working with data and BI in a professional setting
Hands-on experience with Tableau or similar tools, as well as SQL and Azure-based environments
A structured communicator who can work with both technical and non-technical colleagues
A relevant academic degree in IT, Business Intelligence, Computer Science, or similar
Fluent in written and spoken English; Spanish is a plus, but not required


Be part of a collaborative, forward-thinking environment

At BioMar, innovation and collaboration are at the heart of everything we do. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to influence how data is used across our global company - and help us meet our mission of advancing sustainable aquaculture.

You’ll work with dedicated professionals across disciplines and regions in a supportive environment that values learning and initiative. We offer flexibility, professional development, and a chance to make your mark on a company with purpose.

Ready to apply or have questions?

We look forward to hearing from you. If you have any questions about the position, feel free to reach out to our HR Business Partner, Emilie Louise Svenning, on +45 2065 2997. The application process is ongoing, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. Please include your CV when applying.

About BioMar

More than half of the seafood consumed globally comes from aquaculture. At BioMar, we are committed to developing and delivering efficient, sustainable, and healthy aquaculture feed solutions. Innovation and partnerships are at the heart of everything we do, and we are proud that our highly skilled people share this commitment. With feed factories in 13 countries across 4 continents, we supply feed to over 90 countries, supporting more than 45 different species of fish and shrimp. Join us on our journey to innovate aquaculture.

Powered by Partnership. Driven by Innovation.
Show more

Title: Junior Quantitative Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you curious to enter the investment world at Danske Bank and guide our customers in their investment decisions? Join our Investment Concepts team and contribute to developing highly competitive investment solutions that contribute to great customer experiences across the Nordic region.

Join the Investment Concepts Team in the Investment Products & Offerings department

In the Investment Products & Offerings department, part of the broader Private Banking & Investments organization at Danske Bank, we provide the foundation for a highly competitive investment product offering towards Danske Bank’s private customers across the Nordic markets. We constantly seek to enhance our customers' financial wellbeing and guide private customers in their wealth planning anchored by sound investment concepts and recommendations, helping our clients reach their long-term financial goals. The new team member will join our Investment Concepts team, a crucial component of the Investment Products & Offering department. This innovative group is focused on securing the highest standards of quality and innovation in our investment concepts. The team's work concentrates on continuously developing and refining our investment concepts to ensure relevance and value contribution for our customers. Their efforts are vital in maintaining the integrity and effectiveness of our investment recommendations, directly contributing to our overarching goal of enhancing customers’ financial well-being.

In this role within the Investment Concepts team, you will handle both changing and recurring tasks, supporting assignments throughout the Investment Products & Offering organization. Your analytical skills and creative mindset will be key in driving the development and refinement of investment concepts that will shape the future of our customer engagements.

You will:


Develop and implement quantitative methods for diverse projects to enhance data-driven decisions, streamline processes and improve operational efficiency.
Create tools to convert database information into actionable business insights.
Analyse investment portfolios and custody holdings across various customer segments.
Evaluate the effectiveness and relevance of investment recommendations.
Work on developing and refining investment concepts using quantitative foundations.


Detail-oriented quantitative analyst with an interest in investments

We are looking for a candidate with an interest in investments, investment products, and financial markets, who is skilled in developing quantitative frameworks and analyses. Your technical skills, combined with a proactive, open, positive and collaborative mindset, and a wish to engage with many great colleagues, will be essential in advancing our team in a continuously evolving environment. We do not expect you to bring many years of experience, but instead the ideal candidate will have:


Proficiency in SQL and basic knowledge of database schema.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, C#, C++, or R.
Curiosity and motivation for handling non-routine tasks and thriving in engaging settings.
Notable creativity, self-motivation and problem-solving skills with a proven ability to initiate and drive projects efficiently.
Proficiency in English and a Scandinavianlanguage to effectively communicate and collaborate across our diverse teams.


Have we caught your interest?

If you have any questions about the position, please contact Morten Melander, Head of Investment Concepts at mmela@danskebank.dk . Please note that due to the summer holiday period, response times may be longer than usual.

We will begin reviewing applications from August 4th, after which we will start conducting interviews.

We look forward to hearing from you and possibly welcoming you to our team.

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.
Show more

Title: Growth Data Analyst (Remote Europe)
Description:
n8n is a workflow automation platform that uniquely combines AI capabilities with business process automation. We give technical teams the flexibility of code with the speed of no-code, backed by a passionate community of builders. With 500+ integrations and fair-code principles, we're revolutionizing how businesses connect their systems and processes.

We were founded end of 2019 and currently:


🧑‍🤝‍🧑 We’re a diverse team of + 120 talented people
🚀 Our annual recurring revenue is growing over 7x year-over-year
⭐️ With +118k GitHub stars, we are in the top 50 most popular projects of all time on Github
🍾 We were the 25th fastest growing startup last year and 4th BtoB SaaS Rising 100 this year in Europe according to Sifted
🌱 We were Sequoia's first seed investment in Germany, and most recently secured our $60M Series B (February '25, led by Highland)


Join n8n to help us unlock the next level of product-led growth through data.

At n8n, we’re building the most powerful automation platform for technical teams. Our unique blend of low-code flexibility and full-code control gives builders unmatched speed and scalability — backed by one of the world’s most active developer communities. We're building a self-serve motion that’s already powering millions of automations across companies of all sizes. Now, we’re looking for a sharp and curious PLG & Growth Data Analyst to help us deeply understand and optimize our self-serve user funnel — from acquisition through expansion.

🎯 Your main goal will be to enable data-driven ARR growth by uncovering insights that optimize self-service user acquisition, activation, retention, and expansion.

To get there, here’s how you’ll make an impact:

🔍 Become the expert on our PLG funnel


Understand the current self-serve user journey, from signup to expansion, and map drop-off points.
Own and evolve our PLG funnel analytics to track activation, conversion, retention, and monetization.
Conduct quarterly business reviews and funnel performance analyses to identify trends and risks.


🧪 Power experimentation and growth


Analyze the results of PLG experiments and advise teams on what’s working — and what’s not.
Continuously refine our PQL definitions based on behavioral signals and user segmentation.
Evaluate pricing plan performance across user segments and surface monetization opportunities.


🛠 Build tools that make data accessible and actionable


Design and maintain dashboards that track self-serve KPIs and enable rapid decision-making.
Build and scale self-service tools and documentation to help teams answer product and growth questions.
Partner with product, marketing, and analytics to ensure shared metrics and clarity across the funnel.


🤝 Enable cross-functional success


Work closely with Product, Growth, Marketing, and Engineering teams to inform their priorities with data.
Serve as a trusted partner in shaping PLG strategy by identifying new opportunities for activation and expansion.
Champion a culture of experimentation and data-informed decision-making across n8n.


Requirements

Must-haves


🧠 PLG/growth analytics experience: You’ve spent 4–5 years in data roles at high-growth B2B SaaS companies, ideally PLG-led, and know how to interpret behavioral signals and product data.
📐 Experimental mindset: You’ve proposed, designed, and analyzed experiments that drove tangible growth outcomes.
🗣️ Cross-functional communication: You’re known for translating complex data into crisp insights that influence Product, Marketing, and Engineering teams.
🧮 Strong analytical toolkit: You’re highly proficient in SQL and experienced with BigQuery, DBT, Metabase, and Google Sheets.
🤖 Bias for automation & AI: You’re excited about using automation and AI to streamline workflows and unlock new insights.
📚 Academic foundation: You hold a Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or similar).


Nice-to-haves


👾 Experience in devtool or community-led growth environments: You understand the unique patterns of usage and activation in technical audiences.
🔧 Familiarity with n8n: You’ve used our product — or are excited to dive in and explore what makes it so powerful.
🚀 Startup-first mindset: You’re energized by ambiguity, fast decision cycles, and the ability to ship impact quickly.
📊 AB testing expertise: You’ve designed and interpreted A/B and multivariate tests in SaaS products with scale.


Why join us?

At n8n, your work won’t disappear into a slide deck. You'll have direct impact on how we scale our ARR, build our data foundations, and shape the future of product-led growth in one of Europe’s fastest-growing startups. You’ll join a supportive, remote-first team that values autonomy, experimentation, and continuous learning.

Sound like a challenge you’re excited to take on?

Apply now — and help us build the future of automation.

n8n is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We can sponsor visas to Germany; for any other country, you need to have existing right to work.

Our company language is English.

You care about diversity and inclusion? We do too! Check out our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives at n8n (https://www.notion.so/n8n/Diversity-inclusion-and-belonging-n8n-c1bec2fff536422d868b1a438d990e35).

Location disclaimer: If you see multiple job postings for the same role, it is most likely because we're hiring remotely for this role and posting in different locations to make sure every potential candidate can see the role. Please apply to the location you're the most likely to work from in the future.

Benefits


Competitive compensation 💸 – We offer fair and attractive pay.
Ownership 💪 – Our core value is to “empower others,” and we mean it—you’ll get a slice of n8n with equity.
Work/life balance 🏖️ – We work hard but ensure you have time to recharge:
Europe: 30 days of vacation, plus public holidays wherever you are.
US: 15 vacation days, 8 sick days, plus public holidays wherever you are.
Health & wellness 🩺 –
Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.*
US: Comprehensive medical (PPO 1200), dental, and vision plans.
Future planning 💰 –
Europe: We provide pension contributions according to local country norms.*
US: 401(k) retirement plan.
Financial security 🛡️ –
Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.*
US: Short-term & long-term disability insurance, life & AD&D coverage, and additional hospital coverage.
Career growth 📈 – We hire rising stars who grow with us! You’ll get €1K (or equivalent) per year to spend on courses, books, events, or coaching to level up your skills.
A passionate team 🤩 – We love our product, and we prove it with regular hackathons where we see who can build the coolest thing with it!
Remote-first 🌏 – Our team works remotely across Europe, with regular off-sites for team bonding. Some roles, like sales in the US, are hybrid—please check the job description.
Giving back 🤝 – We're big fans of open source, and you'll get $100 per month to support projects you care about.
Transparency 🙏 – We all know what everyone’s working on, how the company is doing—the whole shebang.
An ambitious but kind culture 😍 – People love working here—our eNPS for 2024 is 94!
Country-specific details are provided in your contract.
Show more

  • Conduct quarterly business reviews and funnel performance analyses to identify trends and risks.

  • Analyze the results of PLG experiments and advise teams on what’s working — and what’s not.
  • Continuously refine our PQL definitions based on behavioral signals and user segmentation.
  • Evaluate pricing plan performance across user segments and surface monetization opportunities.

🛠 Build tools that make data accessible and actionable

  • Design and maintain dashboards that track self-serve KPIs and enable rapid decision-making.
  • Build and scale self-service tools and documentation to help teams answer product and growth questions.
  • Partner with product, marketing, and analytics to ensure shared metrics and clarity across the funnel.

🤝 Enable cross-functional success

  • Work closely with Product, Growth, Marketing, and Engineering teams to inform their priorities with data.
  • Serve as a trusted partner in shaping PLG strategy by identifying new opportunities for activation and expansion.
  • Champion a culture of experimentation and data-informed decision-making across n8n.

Requirements

Must-haves

  • 🧠 PLG/growth analytics experience: You’ve spent 4–5 years in data roles at high-growth B2B SaaS companies, ideally PLG-led, and know how to interpret behavioral signals and product data.
  • 📐 Experimental mindset: You’ve proposed, designed, and analyzed experiments that drove tangible growth outcomes.
  • 🗣️ Cross-functional communication: You’re known for translating complex data into crisp insights that influence Product, Marketing, and Engineering teams.
  • 🧮 Strong analytical toolkit: You’re highly proficient in SQL and experienced with BigQuery, DBT, Metabase, and Google Sheets.
  • 🤖 Bias for automation & AI: You’re excited about using automation and AI to streamline workflows and unlock new insights.
  • 📚 Academic foundation: You hold a Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or similar).

Nice-to-haves

  • 👾 Experience in devtool or community-led growth environments: You understand the unique patterns of usage and activation in technical audiences.
  • 🔧 Familiarity with n8n: You’ve used our product — or are excited to dive in and explore what makes it so powerful.
  • 🚀 Startup-first mindset: You’re energized by ambiguity, fast decision cycles, and the ability to ship impact quickly.
  • 📊 AB testing expertise: You’ve designed and interpreted A/B and multivariate tests in SaaS products with scale.

Why join us?

At n8n, your work won’t disappear into a slide deck. You'll have direct impact on how we scale our ARR, build our data foundations, and shape the future of product-led growth in one of Europe’s fastest-growing startups. You’ll join a supportive, remote-first team that values autonomy, experimentation, and continuous learning.

Sound like a challenge you’re excited to take on?

Apply now — and help us build the future of automation.

n8n is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We can sponsor visas to Germany; for any other country, you need to have existing right to work.

Our company language is English.

You care about diversity and inclusion? We do too! Check out our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives at n8n (https://www.notion.so/n8n/Diversity-inclusion-and-belonging-n8n-c1bec2fff536422d868b1a438d990e35).

Location disclaimer: If you see multiple job postings for the same role, it is most likely because we're hiring remotely for this role and posting in different locations to make sure every potential candidate can see the role. Please apply to the location you're the most likely to work from in the future.

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation 💸 – We offer fair and attractive pay.
  • Ownership 💪 – Our core value is to “empower others,” and we mean it—you’ll get a slice of n8n with equity.
  • Work/life balance 🏖️ – We work hard but ensure you have time to recharge:
    • Europe: 30 days of vacation, plus public holidays wherever you are.
    • US: 15 vacation days, 8 sick days, plus public holidays wherever you are.
  • Health & wellness 🩺 –
    • Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.*
    • US: Comprehensive medical (PPO 1200), dental, and vision plans.
  • Future planning 💰 –
    • Europe: We provide pension contributions according to local country norms.*
    • US: 401(k) retirement plan.
  • Financial security 🛡️ –
    • Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.*
    • US: Short-term & long-term disability insurance, life & AD&D coverage, and additional hospital coverage.
  • Career growth 📈 – We hire rising stars who grow with us! You’ll get €1K (or equivalent) per year to spend on courses, books, events, or coaching to level up your skills.
  • A passionate team 🤩 – We love our product, and we prove it with regular hackathons where we see who can build the coolest thing with it!
  • Remote-first 🌏 – Our team works remotely across Europe, with regular off-sites for team bonding. Some roles, like sales in the US, are hybrid—please check the job description.
  • Giving back 🤝 – We're big fans of open source, and you'll get $100 per month to support projects you care about.
  • Transparency 🙏 – We all know what everyone’s working on, how the company is doing—the whole shebang.
  • An ambitious but kind culture 😍 – People love working here—our eNPS for 2024 is 94!
  • Country-specific details are provided in your contract.

Title: Data Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Dawn Health is a leading digital health company that builds high-quality products for pharmaceutical and medical device companies. We help them create apps and platforms that patients and healthcare providers actually use, while meeting the highest regulatory standards. We're looking for an Intermediate Data Specialist to join our team in Copenhagen.




The Opportunity

As an Intermediate Data Specialist, you will help develop our analytics platform that transforms how Life Science clients leverage data within their digital health solutions. You'll build data pipelines, create dashboards, and deliver insights that impact patients and healthcare providers worldwide. Working with Product Owners and cross-functional teams, you'll bridge the gap between technical analytics and product strategy.




Key Responsibilities

Build and maintain scalable ETL/ELT data pipelines ensuring data quality and compliance –
Create product dashboards and KPI visualizations that deliver actionable insights –
Conduct funnel analysis, cohort analysis, and retention modeling to understand user behavior
Set up connections to new data sources and help evolve our data platform
Partner with product managers to identify measurement needs and present insights to leadership
Mentor junior team members and translate technical findings into business value
Contribute ideas to enhance our analytics capabilities and technical approach




Our Tech Stack

We currently use Microsoft Fabric, Power BI, and Azure Data Factory as our core data platform, but we're always looking to evolve and improve. We welcome candidates who can bring fresh ideas and help us enhance our technical approach. Experience with similar technologies like Tableau, Looker, Airflow, dbt, Databricks, Snowflake, or other modern data platforms is highly valued.




What You Bring

3-6 years of experience in data analytics with focus on product analytics
Advanced SQL and Python skills for product data analysis
Experience with BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, Looker) and analytics platforms (Mixpanel, Amplitude, Google Analytics)
Strong stakeholder management skills and ability to influence through data-driven insights
Product analytics expertise including funnel analysis, cohort analysis, and retention modeling
ETL/ELT experience with tools like Azure Data Factory, Airflow, or similar orchestration platforms
Version control experience and collaborative coding practices
Understanding of healthcare data systems and compliance frameworks (preferred)
Degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field




What We Offer

Impact thousands of patients through world-class analytics platform development
Technical ownership of key platform components in a leading digital health scale-up
Opportunity to mentor others and establish best practices in an emerging field
Access to leading pharma clients and cutting-edge analytics approaches
Open, collaborative culture focused on "Code to Save Lives"
Resources to experiment with innovative technologies and make your mark on digital health analytics




About Dawn Health

Dawn Health is a digital health company specializing in developing Software as Medical Device (SaMD) and other regulated healthcare solutions. We deliver both strategic consulting and development of innovative digital therapies targeting patients on a global scale.

Working at Dawn Health is more than just a job. We are not just looking for new employees. We are looking for deeply passionate souls, gifted minds, innovators, team players, entrepreneurs and people who believe they can change the world. We love to build things, change the status quo, and drive a new digital health agenda that will impact 1 million patients by 2030.

Our passion not only includes the urge to make a difference, and "Code to Save Lives", we're also very focused on our people. There is a great social culture at Dawn Health, and throughout the company you will find warm, helpful, and friendly colleagues. When we hire, we do not just look for professional skills and talent, we look for people who will thrive in our environment, and who will make a good addition to the team and contribute to the culture.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Brænder du for at omdanne data til indsigt, og vil du være med til at udvikle innovative og værdiskabende løsninger og rapporter - og løfte den måde vi anvender data på?

Ligger din faglige interesse og motivation i at forvandle data til indsigter og løsninger, der skaber konkret værdi for både kolleger, kunder og partnere? Så har vi det helt rigtige job klar til dig!

Alm. Brand Group er en af Danmarks førende skadeforsikringskoncerner, der består af Alm. Brand Forsikring, Codan Forsikring og Privatsikring. Vi er i konstant udvikling og har stor appetit på innovative data-løsninger, der kan understøtte vores strategiske mål, rådgive og hjælpe vores kunder når de har mest brug for det.

Du skaber indsigt i data som skaber grundlag for handling

Som Data Analyst skal du på den ene side kunne identificere behov og specificere disse i en datamæssig sammenhæng. Hvor du også udfordrer og inspirerer dine kolleger konstruktivt med nye indsigter og ideer. På den anden side skal du kunne udvikle dataløsninger og rapporteringer med data, hvor genanvendelse og standardisering er vigtigt. Dette sker alt sammen med udgangspunkt i vores nye konsoliderede og cloudbaserede dataplatform i et stærkt datafagligt miljø sammen med et fast forretningsvendt team, som har et specifikt data- og forretningsdomæne fokus.

Dine Primære Opgaver Bliver At


Sparre med kollegaer omkring deres udfordringer og behov for rapportering og indsigt i data
Udvikle data- og rapporteringsløsninger vha. Microsoft Power BI og andre dataværktøjer
Bidrage til forretningsmæssige afklaringer og udvikling af datastrukturer på ny data platform
Bidrage med adoptionen af nye og eksisterende dataløsninger hos brugerne
Udarbejde dataanalyser og indsigter baseret på data i samarbejde med brugerne
Vedligeholde og videreudvikle eksisterende løsninger


Erfaring med udvikling af løsninger baseret på data fra en struktureret dataplatform

Vi leder efter en faglig profil, som har lyst til at forstå forretningsmæssige udfordringer og kunne se muligheder i løsninger med dataindsigter og løsninger. Du skal kunne udvikle løsningerne med moderne data og business intelligence værktøjer i samarbejde med et tværfagligt team og i dialog med flere forskellige forretningsmæssige interessenter. Du kan derfor begå dig med både meget faglige dygtige specialister og mere strategisk orienterede ledere.

Derudover Rummer Dit CV


En videregående uddannelse med vægt på dataanalyse og IT
Erfaring med at samle, analysere og afklare behov og krav
Erfaring med udvikling af løsninger og rapporteringer baseret på data fra en struktureret dataplatform eller data warehouse
Erfaring med dataudtræk vha. SQL, dataanalyse og præsentation af data i Microsoft Power BI
Gerne erfaring som business intelligence analytiker, udvikler eller konsulent
Gode dansk- og engelskkundskaber, skriftligt og mundtligt


Din nye afdeling og team

Din nye arbejdsplads bliver Alm. Brand Groups hovedsæde på Midtermolen nær Østerport Station og Langelinie. Her får du godt 50 gode kolleger og faste konsulenter i vores centrale dataafdelinger, hvor vi arbejder tæt integreret i fagligt tværgående teams og på tværs af landegrænser. Du vil arbejde fast sammen med det samme team på typisk 4-6 data engineers, udviklere og analytikere. Du kan se frem til at komme ind i et ambitiøst og meget positivt miljø, hvor alle hjælper hinanden, og hvor der også er god plads til at have det sjovt sammen.

Ansøgning og kontakt

Er du vores nye kollega, så send os din ansøgning med CV snarest muligt.

Ansøgningsfristen er 3. august, og vi behandler herefter ansøgninger. Vi forventer at afholde 1. runde samtaler i uge 33 og 2. runde i uge 34. Opstart efter aftale.

For spørgsmål, kontakt venligst chef for Data Solutions, Ole Michelsen på 3047 8921.

Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig og håber, du vil være med til at forme fremtiden for data i Alm. Brand Group!

Alm. Brand Group er en af Danmarks største forsikringsselskaber, og omfatter både Alm. Brand, Codan, Privatsikring og Erhvervssikring. Vi er over 2000 medarbejdere, der arbejder for at sikre og forsikre vores flere end 700.000 kunder. Vores fundament er fokus på kunden, høj arbejdsglæde og vores værdisæt: Vi er ambitiøse, Vi er ordentlige, Vi udviser tillid. Læs mere om Alm. Brand Group på almbrandgroup.com. Følg os på LinkedIn: Alm. Brand Group. Vi opfordrer alle uanset alder, køn, baggrund, handicap eller oprindelse til at søge stillingen.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Maternity Cover (7 months)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Scheduling isn't simply filling shifts. It's finding the sweet spot that enables businesses to grow and team members to enjoy the perfect work/life balance.






At Planday from Xero, we aim to use Agentic AI to build a future where managers can seamlessly free up invaluable time for their business and teams. We're not just building software: we're on a mission to make shift work more human, to change work/life balance from a luxury to a reality for all shift workers. We're using advanced technology to help humans reach their full potential. At work and in life.






Founded in 2004, Planday is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark and helps create perfect schedules for hundreds of thousands of users across the world.






As a Data Analyst, you'll be reporting directly to our Head of Data & Analytics and will play a strategic role in transforming complex data into actionable insights that directly fuel our business growth and critical decisions.


You'll craft compelling data narratives, turning raw information into valuable assets that guide product development and key strategic choices.


Collaborating across teams, you'll uncover pivotal metrics and deep customer insights, empowering informed decisions throughout Planday. Through impactful visualizations and persuasive communication, you'll ensure these insights resonate with stakeholders at all levels.


Furthermore, you'll leverage advanced analytical techniques to pioneer predictive modeling and automation, fostering a culture of data-driven innovation that is central to Planday's continued success.






This role is a maternity cover role for about 7 months.







What you'll do

Collaborate cross-functionally with product, commercial, and leadership teams to define, track, and report critical metrics, delivering comprehensive customer insights.
Design and maintain robust data models that transform raw data into high-value assets, ensuring accuracy and quality.
Develop impactful, hands-on solutions, visualizations, and dashboards across the business, primarily utilizing Tableau to communicate insights effectively.
Leverage proficiency in Python, R, and SQL for advanced data manipulation, statistical analysis, and ensuring high data quality.
Apply advanced statistical analysis techniques for summarizing, interpreting, and predicting data, alongside machine learning concepts for predictive modeling techniques.
Translate complex data into clear, actionable narratives through compelling data storytelling, impactful presentations, and strong interpersonal communication.
During your time with us we’re expecting key projects to include: Product-Market-Fit analysis, customer lifecycle insights, as well as supporting product teams.







Success looks like

Exceptional data models that consistently deliver accurate, high-quality data assets, underpinning strategic initiatives.
Proactive delivery of actionable insights and critical metrics that directly lead to informed decisions and tangible business improvements for product and commercial teams.
Development and implementation of intuitive and highly impactful visualizations and dashboards that significantly elevate data-driven decision-making across Planday.
Insights and recommendations that are consistently trusted and acted upon by product and commercial teams, stemming from rigorous analysis and robust data practices.
Clear and compelling communication of complex data insights, fostering understanding and alignment among stakeholders, resulting in measurable positive business impact.
Proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking in addressing data-related challenges, leading to continuous improvement and advancement in our analytical capabilities.
Successful exploration and implementation of advanced analytical techniques, including machine learning, to unlock new opportunities and generate groundbreaking insights.







What you'll bring with you

Proven experience in Python, R, and advanced SQL (including window functions, CTEs) for advanced data management and statistical analysis.
Proficiency in crafting compelling data stories, leveraging visualization tools like Tableau to transform complex datasets into clear, impactful visualizations that resonate with diverse stakeholders.
Proven capability in product opportunity sizing, metric development, and building robust metric trees to guide product strategy and evaluation.
Demonstrated ability to lead and optimize data wrangling and cleaning processes across multiple, complex projects.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of translating complex data insights into compelling narratives through data storytelling and high-impact presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
A highly analytical mindset, consistently identifying and solving complex data challenges with innovative solutions that directly drive data-driven strategic decisions.
Practical application of machine learning fundamentals to solve specific business problems through predictive modeling.







At Planday, we offer you

Benefits like pension, health insurance and generous vacation
Flexible remote work
Strong social culture with lots of team and company activities
Meaningful work – everyone at Planday contributes to improving the lives of shift workers around the globe
Healthy work-life balance and autonomous approach to work. We trust in you and your abilities







Finally, our offices are not just workplaces (although they are pretty nice and well-located, we have to say!). Plandayers are open and welcoming and at Planday, everyone has the freedom and support to show their true self at work.






At Planday, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are the cornerstones of innovation and a vibrant workplace culture, and we highly value the strength that diverse backgrounds offer.






As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to create an equitable experience for all our candidates throughout the process. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process.


All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

Show more

    • Proactive delivery of actionable insights and critical metrics that directly lead to informed decisions and tangible business improvements for product and commercial teams.
    • Development and implementation of intuitive and highly impactful visualizations and dashboards that significantly elevate data-driven decision-making across Planday.
    • Insights and recommendations that are consistently trusted and acted upon by product and commercial teams, stemming from rigorous analysis and robust data practices.
    • Clear and compelling communication of complex data insights, fostering understanding and alignment among stakeholders, resulting in measurable positive business impact.
    • Proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking in addressing data-related challenges, leading to continuous improvement and advancement in our analytical capabilities.
    • Successful exploration and implementation of advanced analytical techniques, including machine learning, to unlock new opportunities and generate groundbreaking insights.



What you'll bring with you

    • Proven experience in Python, R, and advanced SQL (including window functions, CTEs) for advanced data management and statistical analysis.
    • Proficiency in crafting compelling data stories, leveraging visualization tools like Tableau to transform complex datasets into clear, impactful visualizations that resonate with diverse stakeholders.
    • Proven capability in product opportunity sizing, metric development, and building robust metric trees to guide product strategy and evaluation.
    • Demonstrated ability to lead and optimize data wrangling and cleaning processes across multiple, complex projects.
    • Exceptional communication skills, capable of translating complex data insights into compelling narratives through data storytelling and high-impact presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
    • A highly analytical mindset, consistently identifying and solving complex data challenges with innovative solutions that directly drive data-driven strategic decisions.
    • Practical application of machine learning fundamentals to solve specific business problems through predictive modeling.



At Planday, we offer you

    • Benefits like pension, health insurance and generous vacation
    • Flexible remote work
    • Strong social culture with lots of team and company activities
    • Meaningful work – everyone at Planday contributes to improving the lives of shift workers around the globe
    • Healthy work-life balance and autonomous approach to work. We trust in you and your abilities



Finally, our offices are not just workplaces (although they are pretty nice and well-located, we have to say!). Plandayers are open and welcoming and at Planday, everyone has the freedom and support to show their true self at work.



At Planday, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are the cornerstones of innovation and a vibrant workplace culture, and we highly value the strength that diverse backgrounds offer.



As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to create an equitable experience for all our candidates throughout the process. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process.

All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

Title: Senior Data Analyst – Finance
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Finance team and help us grow smarter as a scale-up. This new role has been created to address the need for stronger data control and quality assurance, particularly to support billing accuracy, Accounts Receivable (AR), Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A), and management reporting. In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring data integrity, creating reports, and providing data-driven insights to enable more accurate financial processes and decision-making.

This role reports directly to the Chief Financial Officer (CFO).

Main Responsibilities


Data Integrity Assurance:
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data used for client invoicing and self-billing processes.
Work closely with the Accounts Receivable team to ensure data used for account reconciliation is reliable and accurate.
Support FP&A and management by providing quality data for in-depth analysis.
Data Extraction & Reporting:
Extract, manipulate, and provide data to support the Accounts Receivable team with client queries and account reconciliations.
Develop and provide reports to support group reporting processes.
Provide ad-hoc data and reports to the CFO and management on company performance, sales trends, and financial metrics.
Enable detailed financial analysis through accurate data sets, helping to drive strategic decisions.
Database Management & Querying:
Utilize your technical skills to ensure the smooth extraction, indexing, and organization of financial data across various databases.
Create and optimize SQL queries for data extraction and reporting, ensuring accuracy and speed.
Manage and improve the database structure, ensuring links, indices, and relationships are properly established for efficiency.
Cross-functional Support:
Act as a bridge between finance and other departments by providing essential data support.
Collaborate with the AR team, FP&A, and management to ensure data quality is maintained across various financial processes.

Profile


Experience:
5-7 years of experience in a data-driven role, ideally with exposure to finance, accounting, or FP&A functions.
Strong background in data extraction, reporting, and ensuring data accuracy.
Experience with tools and technologies such as SQL (queries), Python, Metabase, and Power BI for reporting and data analysis.
Technical Skills:
Advanced proficiency in SQL for querying databases, as well as experience with Python for automation or data manipulation.
Strong knowledge of data visualization tools such as Power BI or Metabase for creating dynamic reports and dashboards.
Good understanding of database structures, including indexing and linking, to optimize performance and reporting accuracy.
Experience working with data extracted from ERP systems such as Microsoft Dynamics 365 (D365), including familiarity with its structure and reporting outputs.
Finance Knowledge:
Basic understanding of finance processes, including billing, accounts receivable, financial analysis, and group reporting.
Knowledge of key financial metrics and how to manipulate data for FP&A purposes.
Personal Attributes:
Hands-on, flexible, and agile with a “can-do” attitude—able to manage competing priorities and adapt to a fast-changing environment.
Eager to be part of a transformative journey within the finance function, with a focus on improving data quality and analytical capabilities.
Strong attention to detail and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Benefits


Flexible Work Environment: Enjoy a collaborative, inclusive, and open workplace designed to fit your needs and support work-life balance.
Competitive Package: Receive a competitive salary, an 11% company pension plan, and a comprehensive benefits package.
Time to Recharge: Benefit from 32 paid vacation days (5 weeks + 5 extra) and paid parental leave to focus on what matters most.
Career Growth: Access professional development opportunities and grow your career in a high-impact, high-growth industry.
Stay Energized: Enjoy excellent coffee, tea, free snacks, and subsidized lunches at the office.
Stay Active: Use our Spirii gym and shared company car to keep moving.
Make an Impact: Be part of a team driving the future of sustainable energy while working on meaningful projects.


Why Join Us?

As the Senior Data Analyst in our rapidly growing scale-up, you will play a key role in transforming how we manage and utilize data across the finance function. You will have the opportunity to shape the future of our financial reporting, billing, and analysis processes, all while being a key player in a high-growth environment. This is a great opportunity for someone who is passionate about data and finance, and who wants to make a significant impact in a dynamic, fast-paced company.

About Spirii – Who We Are

Spirii is a full-service e-Mobility provider, which offers hardware and software charging solutions to companies in the private and the public sector. Spirii has recently celebrated its four-year anniversary as a founded company, however the people in Spirii have extensive experience working with electric cars and charging, as well as development of future transport- and energy systems.

Spirii is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences. Spirii strives to create an inclusive and diverse workplace, and we encourage all qualified applicants to apply regardless of age, gender, race, sexual/religious orientation, or disability.

Title: Data Analyst for Performance Management (H/F) - SATAIR A/S
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description: Do you want to improve the performance and customer satisfaction of the Aftermarket division of Airbus? What the job isThis role, based in Copenhagen, reports to the Head of Performance Management (ASAXP) and requires continuous cross-functional collaboration with our Operations functions, Sales, Product Management, Finance, HR, and IT Teams from all our sites in the world. You will integrate the Business Performance team which is spread across the globe, matching Satair's operational footprint. It means working in multi-disciplinary and multi-cultural teams with a focus and responsibility on delivering pragmatic solutions. We are looking for our new Process & Performance Manager who is ready to roll up their sleeves and help us develop actionable, data-driven insights and solve business problems, using various quantitative tools and core project management skills. The candidate will challenge the status quo as well as be resolutely determined to ensure operational excellence by speeding implementation across the organization to make a difference in terms of performance perceived by customers. Key deliverables:


Lead Customer Performance Improvement projects with the aim of reducing/eradicating customer Irritants
work directly with customers to understand pain points from a data driven perspective in collaboration with our Sales organization
Translate customer satisfaction expectations into operational targets
Deploy Airbus Continuous Improvement initiates (Called Airbus Operating System - AOS) deployment in Satair in close collaboration with Airbus Customer Services AOS team (S function) and Satair Functions.
Support operational functions in their AOS/continuous improvement deployment
Benchmarking across the company
How you will contribute to the teamKey competencies needed to succeed in this position


Strong analytical & Problem Solving: Demonstrate exceptional troubleshooting and problem-solving skills in an industrial environment, to structure ambiguous situations and to use data analysis to the extent possible to find and drive solutions.
Delivering Results: Ability to successfully deliver end-to-end solutions in complex organisation under tight timelines, working through the multiple constraints along the way with agility .
Influencing and foster collaboration: Innovative leader with the ability to identify opportunities and influence / challenge stakeholders with unbiased view across all functions to gain support and overcome resistance with trustful collaboration, data, persuasion and common goals.
Data Analysis Skills: Experience in Python, including data manipulation and analysis libraries Familiarity with database systems and SQL Ability to visualize and communicate data and analyses
Excellent communication (especially in English): Ability to create synthetic and precise status reports with internal and cross functional teams for reviews with executive and senior leadership teams synthesizing large quantities of data to help create new, step-change initiatives for the organisation. Communicate expectations and requirements equally well at all levels, and capacity to write well-reasoned and data-driven proposals, performing your own data analysis as necessary
What does your next challenge look like?At Satair, we believe in sustainable aviation that allows people to travel and connect across the globe. We are on a mission to provide world class material solutions that keep aircraft flying and extend their lifespan. In Satair, you can challenge the status quo, pioneer new ways of working, and generate real value for airlines and suppliers worldwide. Being part of the Airbus family gives us the opportunity to live a global mindset, working in international teams and collaborating across functions, sites and cultures. If you want to work as one team embracing a can-do attitude in a demanding environment, then we offer a great place to explore, learn, and grow. Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company! About SATAIRSatair offers first class material management solutions in the aftermarket business of the aviation industry. We are working to be the most customer-centric organization in providing commercial aviation spares parts to make the world continue flying. We are constantly taking customer experience to new levels by improving how we fulfill and deliver customers’ orders quickly and accurately, anywhere in the world. To meet this goal, Satair is continually striving to innovate and provide best-in-class service levels by pioneering new products and services in a fast growing business environment. With our global functional organization spanning across 11 different sites and locations worldwide with more than 1.800 people and a turnover of $3.0 billion, you will be part of a truly global family. Our customers have the ultimate goal to operate their fleet and our Airbus aircraft safely, efficiently in a cost-time-quality effective manner and of course with the expected comfort level for their customers. We at Satair do everything to support our customers in this. If you want to know more about our business, have a closer look at our website www.SATAIR.com or check out our SATAIR Youtube Channel at www.youtube.com/sataircompany ! What do we offer at SATAIR?At SATAIR, you will find much more than a job - we offer you the possibility of growing both your personal and professional capacities in a fun, supportive and informal working environment, where you will be encouraged to engage, share knowledge and ideas. SATAIR is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We love to bring in people with different backgrounds and experiences as we believe it enhances our performance immensely! Here is a selection of some of the benefits we offer our employees in Copenhagen:


Competitive remuneration, including short term incentive bonus on all levels
Work/life balance: hybrid working, flex time, maternity/paternity/parental leave, 29 days of holiday + senior and flex days
Personal development: personalized development plans, large portfolio of learning solutions and many internal mobility opportunities, both locally and globally
Health and well-being: Health insurance, in-house canteen with many healthy options
Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company Please send us your application as soon as possible to get the opportunity to become part of an exceptional global team! We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. When applying for the position, you accept our data privacy statement: http://www.SATAIR.com/privacy This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.Company: Satair A/SContract Type:PermanentExperience Level:ProfessionalJob Family:Digital By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com . At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data & Automation Engineer




PNO Group, Copenhagen




PNO is the Nordic’s largest trailer rental company. We are a family-owned company established in 1975 with our head oce in Copenhagen, and with branches in Germany, Finland, Norway, Sweden, Denmark & the Netherlands.




At PNO, we are looking for smart people who are curious at heart and always looking for new ways of doing things. In a nutshell, we are a human-centred organisation looking for team players who bring their honest selves to work every day.




About the job




We are looking for a tech savvy individual to take our data and automation setup to the next level. Over the past years we have built up base infrastructure for data and reporting mainly using PowerBI, PostgreSQL, Azure data factory and Databricks.




We are now looking for someone to help take that to the next level especially focusing more on data sync and alignment between systems including automation of that.




You will be required to have an eye on the strategic aspect in terms of how we structure our data landscape and connect systems, but still enjoy spending most of your time with getting your hands dirty developing pipelines and automations.




You’ll play a central role in syncing and aligning data between systems and automating where it really matters. You care about impact, not complexity, and are able to make strategic calls about where to focus, while being hands-on with implementation.




One day you might be helping design how we align data models between our ERP and CRM, while you the other day will code robots to handle data in our AP system.




Skills, experience and background




5+ years Data engineering experience with ETL/ELT pipeline development and data architecture.
Comfortable navigating real world, resource-constrained environment and prioritising what moves the needle.
Knowledge of all or some of PowerBI, Azure Data Factory, Databricks, and PostgreSQL, Power Automate.
Experience working with a stack of loosely connected cloud systems and using scripts, APIs, automated browser robots and similar to bridge the gaps.
Proven ability to design practical data models that connect operational and commercial systems (e.g. ERP and CRM).
A sharp, structured thinker who values rational decision-making and can clearly communicate trade-offs.
Strong ownership mindset and an instinct for simple, high-leverage solutions over engineering.




We invest in your success




An organization with a dynamic team of smart and thoughtful individuals.
A team-first culture with high ambition and low ego.
Competitive salary and meaningful work.
Regular coaching from experienced leaders.




If you’re excited by this opportunity and see yourself in this role, we’d love to hear from you.

Show more

Title: ESG & Impact Analyst
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re looking for a sharp, curious ESG & Impact Analyst to help shape how we measure what matters.

As a venture house spanning evergreen investment company PSV Foundry and the two individual VC funds PSV Tech and PSV Hafnium, we bring two decades of experience in VC fund building, startup investing and portfolio management to the table. Born out of DTU – The Technical University of Denmark – we’re not here to box-tick compliance. We’re all in on the one-to-one correlation between impact and business success. In this role, you’ll be key to making that connection real.

This is a hands-on role, ideal for someone who wants to work at the frontier of impact, tech, and venture. You’ll get a front-row seat to a vibrant community of founders and ecosystem players, and the chance to leave your fingerprints on something that’s built to scale.

What you’ll (actually) be doing

You’ll be working alongside our Head of ESG & Impact, directly supporting our mission to make ESG and Impact data useful, actionable, and founder-friendly. Your work help lay the foundation for how future startups across the Nordics, and possibly beyond, integrate impact strategy into their core business.

You’ll assist founders in understanding sustainability expectations, navigating early-stage ESG & Impact challenges, and co-creating simple, scalable impact strategies. Think; practical input on KPIs, diversity metrics, responsible AI use – and practical, founder-first playbooks.

You’ll support VC funds through due diligence processes, build and verify emissions baselines for target companies, and turn ESG-speak into clear, actionable reporting that matters to LPs. Think: Scope 3 progress across PSV, tailored impact frameworks aligned with funds strategies, policies that make sense for early-stage investing, systems to track, aggregate, and improve both financial and impact KPIs - from first deal to exit.

You’ll manage the backend of our ESG & Impact reporting process – collecting the right data, ensuring regulatory alignment (hello SFRD, CSRD and the Taxonomy), and improving how we use that data sheet to sharpen strategy and decision-making. Think: regular data collection, structuring, and analysis of ESG & Impact data – ensuring data accuracy and timely reporting to internal and external stakeholders.

You’ll assist in peer research on ESG regulation, impact trends, and responsible investment practices to keep PSV ahead of the curve.


What we think you bring

Let’s be honest we’re not hiring your CV. We’re hiring your brain. Your bias for action. Your “I haven’t tried it before, but I Googled it, or maybe more relevant, I asked the chat and made it work” kind of energy.

We want you who turns messy questions into clarity without asking for a 40-slide brief. The one who looks at a dashboard and thinks: Cool, but how does this help founders actually do better stuff?

We think this might look like:

You’re a BSc or MSc student in something like data science, sustainability, innovation, economics, or something similar that sounds clever on Linkedin.
You’re a student who flinches at the phrase “business as usual” and physically recoils when someone brings up CSR like it’s still 2006.
You’re “structured”, “data-driven”, and “know your way around a spreadsheet (don’t we all, after crying over one too many Google Sheets?)
You’re familiar with frameworks like the GHG Protocol and accounting, Sustainable Finance Disclosure Regulation, Taxanomy assessments etc. – aka the alphabet soup of sustainability.
You’re a person who “cares deeply about people and planet” and dreams in systems-thinking slides.

In fewer words, if you’re someone who can hold a climate report and a commercial mindset in the same hand, then we really want to talk.

We’d love to hear from you - even if you don’t tick every box. This is just our best attempt to describe the role realistically. We don’t care about traditional credentials if your drive and mindset are aligned. Sometimes, the right person is someone we haven’t yet had the imagination to look for.
