HTML:
We’re looking for a sharp, curious ESG & Impact Analyst to help shape how we measure what matters.

As a venture house spanning evergreen investment company PSV Foundry and the two individual VC funds PSV Tech and PSV Hafnium, we bring two decades of experience in VC fund building, startup investing and portfolio management to the table. Born out of DTU – The Technical University of Denmark – we’re not here to box-tick compliance. We’re all in on the one-to-one correlation between impact and business success. In this role, you’ll be key to making that connection real.

This is a hands-on role, ideal for someone who wants to work at the frontier of impact, tech, and venture. You’ll get a front-row seat to a vibrant community of founders and ecosystem players, and the chance to leave your fingerprints on something that’s built to scale.

What you’ll (actually) be doing

You’ll be working alongside our Head of ESG & Impact, directly supporting our mission to make ESG and Impact data useful, actionable, and founder-friendly. Your work help lay the foundation for how future startups across the Nordics, and possibly beyond, integrate impact strategy into their core business.

  • You’ll assist founders in understanding sustainability expectations, navigating early-stage ESG & Impact challenges, and co-creating simple, scalable impact strategies. Think; practical input on KPIs, diversity metrics, responsible AI use – and practical, founder-first playbooks.
  • You’ll support VC funds through due diligence processes, build and verify emissions baselines for target companies, and turn ESG-speak into clear, actionable reporting that matters to LPs. Think: Scope 3 progress across PSV, tailored impact frameworks aligned with funds strategies, policies that make sense for early-stage investing, systems to track, aggregate, and improve both financial and impact KPIs - from first deal to exit.
  • You’ll manage the backend of our ESG & Impact reporting process – collecting the right data, ensuring regulatory alignment (hello SFRD, CSRD and the Taxonomy), and improving how we use that data sheet to sharpen strategy and decision-making. Think: regular data collection, structuring, and analysis of ESG & Impact data – ensuring data accuracy and timely reporting to internal and external stakeholders.
  • You’ll assist in peer research on ESG regulation, impact trends, and responsible investment practices to keep PSV ahead of the curve.

What we think you bring

Let’s be honest we’re not hiring your CV. We’re hiring your brain. Your bias for action. Your “I haven’t tried it before, but I Googled it, or maybe more relevant, I asked the chat and made it work” kind of energy.

We want you who turns messy questions into clarity without asking for a 40-slide brief. The one who looks at a dashboard and thinks: Cool, but how does this help founders actually do better stuff?

We think this might look like:

  • You’re a BSc or MSc student in something like data science, sustainability, innovation, economics, or something similar that sounds clever on Linkedin.
  • You’re a student who flinches at the phrase “business as usual” and physically recoils when someone brings up CSR like it’s still 2006.
  • You’re “structured”, “data-driven”, and “know your way around a spreadsheet (don’t we all, after crying over one too many Google Sheets?)
  • You’re familiar with frameworks like the GHG Protocol and accounting, Sustainable Finance Disclosure Regulation, Taxanomy assessments etc. – aka the alphabet soup of sustainability.
  • You’re a person who “cares deeply about people and planet” and dreams in systems-thinking slides.

In fewer words, if you’re someone who can hold a climate report and a commercial mindset in the same hand, then we really want to talk.

We’d love to hear from you - even if you don’t tick every box. This is just our best attempt to describe the role realistically. We don’t care about traditional credentials if your drive and mindset are aligned. Sometimes, the right person is someone we haven’t yet had the imagination to look for.

Title: Business Insights & Report Specialist
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Business Insight & Reporting Specialist with expertise in Power BI Reporting/Front-end to join our Data & Digitalization team. This role will be instrumental in developing, maintaining, and optimizing reporting solutions that drive business insights, using a combination of tabular models and diverse data sources. The individual will also be a key player in implementing our data strategy. 
 

The role:

This role will focus on designing dynamic performance reports and dashboards, mainly using Power BI, to provide valuable insights for business evaluation and strategic planning. The right candidate will collaborate with senior leadership from all departments and IT teams to ensure data integrity and accessible reporting.

Furthermore, you will:

Design and deliver Power BI reports and dashboards highlighting KPIs on a strategic, tactical and an operational level.
Provide regular and ad-hoc reporting to support the whole business to become more data driven.
Collaborate with teams to align reports with organizational goals.
Develop interactive reports and dashboards integrating data from multiple sources using Power BI.
Ensure reports are accessible and actionable, supporting business users in decision-making.
Maintain comprehensive documentation for reports, models, and data processes.
Implement controls to ensure data quality and manage access protocols.
 


The Team:

The Data & Digitalization team consists of three sub-departments: Applications, Data Strategy & Governance and BI & Architecture. You will be in the BI & Architecture team with four colleagues. All of them are located at the Aarhus office. However, you will be working closely together with Data Strategy & Governance and Applications. You will be working with and reporting for the senior leaders to support strategic decision-making based on Power BI reports.


Qualifications:

The ideal candidate will have strong experience in Power BI Front-end development, with a demonstrated ability to track, analyze, and communicate financial and operational performance metrics to support informed decision-making across the business.
 

Furthermore, you have:

A Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Business Intelligence, Finance, Data Science, UX Design, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in Power BI front-end, financial reporting, or business intelligence, with a strong focus on performance management reporting.
Proven expertise in Power BI, including creating visually compelling, report and dashboards development, data modelling, DAX, and Power Query.
Worked with tabular models and the creating of semantic models.
In-depth knowledge of financial and operational performance metrics and experience reporting on KPIs such as revenue, margins, costs, and profitability.
Excellent problem-solving skills with a proactive approach to identifying and addressing reporting issues.


What will make you stand out:

Power BI certification (e.g., Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate).
Experience with Microsoft Fabric.
Understanding of SQL for querying data sources and enhancing reporting capabilities.
 


We offer

At Stibo System, we offer more than just a job. We put people first and inspire you to become the best version of yourself.

We care about our colleague’s work-life balance, and we offer flexibility through a hybrid work model

International: A growing global company, worldwide career opportunities, and multicultural teams

Well-being: A caring and inspiring environment, promoting a happy and healthy lifestyle through a wide range of facilities and activities
 



Join Stibo Systems, where we embrace 'All Kinds of Data Minds.' 

Stibo Systems is a global company with a Nordic heritage. We help companies transform into digital leaders through market-leading multidomain master data management that delivers transparency. Through our solution, large brands (our customers) connect data across their products, customers, stores, employees, suppliers, digital assets and much, much more.


Our people are key to our success and at Stibo Systems, you'll find an environment that values data driven, creativity, curiosity, and analytical thinking. We're committed to making you feel trusted, invested in, and connected, fostering a workplace where every data mind thrives. Be part of our journey to digital leadership!


Interested?

We invite candidates for interviews on a continuous basis, so please apply as soon as possible.

Title: Freelance: Data Engineer
Description:
We’re looking for a Data Engineer to join our client's dynamic team.




Key Responsibilities:




Provide analytical insights and support the development applications through close collaboration with other products teams.
Ensure data accuracy and consistency by implementing validation checks and cleaning processes to maintain high-quality data.
Engineer products to the highest standards of security and data privacy by implementing and following security and data privacy principles from ideation to production release and beyond.​
Engineer products that implement business logic, modern design patterns and architectural principles​.
Work with stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver solutions aligned with organizational goals.




Required Skills & Experience:




Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and C#/TypeScript
Solid experience with Databricks or equivalent cloud-based data engineering platforms
In-depth knowledge of data engineering principles and practices, with an emphasis on data transformation, integration and analytics
Experience with SQL would be beneficial also
Familiarity with data modelling concepts and practices, and data visualization tools
Practical experience with AWS and/or Azure cloud platforms in deploying and managing data solutions
Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and a commitment to quality
Superb communication skills, capable of effectively collaborating with diverse collaborators




Nice to Have:




Curious about API-design.
Curious about SAP.
Curious about infrastructure.
Curious about Terraform
Experience with automated testing.







📍 Location: Copenhagen (Hybrid – 3 days onsite/week)

📅 Start Date: 1st August 2025

📆 Contract Duration: Until end of 2025

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
I have a new role for an experienced Data Engineer to work for a leading digital transformation partner, driving innovation with tailored IT solutions, expert consulting, and secure technology for businesses across diverse industries worldwide, who are going through an exciting growth phase.




There are based both in Denmark and this is a Hybrid position.




Responsibilities:

Create and optimize data platforms: Microsoft Fabric and Azure
Help future-proof customers' data platforms through cloud migration projects.
Use various technologies and resources to achieve desired results: SQL Server, Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Data Lake, Lakehouse, etc.
Collaborate throughout the development cycle – from ideation and requirements to development, testing and delivery, to ensure the Business Intelligence of the future.




Tech Stack - Microsoft Technologies




Salary - Up to 70,000 SEK p/m Depending on experience




Qualifications:

Minimum 5 years experience as a Data Engineer
Experience with Microsoft tool (Power BI / SQL / Databricks / Azure / Fabric)
Fluent Danish & English




This is a great opportunity for anyone that's looking for growth opportunities with one of the worlds biggest consultancies

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Summary

Unique opportunity well suited to a sharp mind that is mission-aligned on climate impact. Role will focus on database construction and data analysis that central to overall company operations, along with ad-hoc support in other areas.

Details

In this role, you will take lead on building and managing a structured database for our feedstock material (geochemistry, particle size, etc.) and trial data (agronomic effects, carbon removals) . The database should be user-friendly, with a visual interface/API which others can easily use to add, edit and view data. For this, you will collaborate across different teams in the company to support cross-functional analytics and reporting needs.

Additional tasks will include supporting ad-hoc data analysis, IT needs (e.g website updates) and field trial operations (e.g. soil sampling, feedstock logistics) if necessary.

This is an excellent opportunity for direct exposure to the extremely promising permanent carbon removal approach called "Enhanced Rock Weathering" (ERW).

Criteria


Currently enrolled in a data science, computer science, IT, engineering or relevant program at a Danish University.
Experience in processing and organising large quantities of technical data, ideally using relevant DB management system and programming skills (e.g MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB etc.).
Entrepreneurial “can do” attitude, able to work independently and willing to take lead on projects.
Passionate about creating positive impact in the world, particularly in terms of climate and sustainability.
Basic familiarity with crop agriculture, soil science and/or geology principles is a plus, but not strictly necessary.


Start date: August or September 2025 (we will conduct interviews until we find the right candidate)

Contract type: Typical Danish part time student (Studentmedarbejder) / 15-20 hours per week

Contract length: 1 year, with potential to extend to a 2nd year if appropriate.

Title: Analytics Consultant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Analytics Consultant til H&B Analytics i København




H&B Analytics søger en dygtig analytiker med forretningsforståelse, som har lyst til at løse komplekse problemstillinger for vores klienter og som sætter en ære i at omdanne data til actionable insights.




H&B Analytics leverer analyser i verdensklasse via to etablerede brands: H&B | Hildebrandt & Brandi og EPSI Rating Danmark. H&B Analytics er et subbrand til H&B | Hildebrandt & Brandi og derfor en stærk kombination af startup og etableret virksomhed.




Vi sætter en ære i at levere handlingsorienterede indsigter baseret på solide analyser og stærk forretningsforståelse. Teamet deler kontorfaciliteter med H&B og EPSI, og du vil derfor få din daglige gang i et dynamisk miljø med inspirerende kolleger og sjove samtaler ved frokostbordet.




Hvem er vi, og hvad tilbyder vi dig?

Hos H&B Analytics er vores to primære opgaver at løse projekter for og sammen med management konsulenterne i H&B og at drive EPSI Rating Danmark.




I H&B-regi leverer vi komplekse analyser ifm. strategiske projekter for H&B samt prædiktionsmodeller, undersøgelsesdesign og ikke mindst indsigt baseret på data og en bred vifte af analytiske metoder.




I EPSI Rating Danmark tilbyder vi kundetilfredshedsundersøgelser, branchestudier og en lang række andre stakeholder-analyser for førende virksomheder i Danmark.




For begge virksomheder er det essentielt, at vi ikke bare leverer resultater – vi leverer handlingsorienteret indsigt – primært på kunder, men også andre aspekter af virksomheden.




Vores klienter er typisk store, ambitiøse virksomheder, og vi arbejder i langvarige samarbejder, hvor vi engagerer os i klienternes virkelighed både personligt og fagligt for at matche deres behov og situation.




Vi vokser og søger nu en analytiker til vores kontor på Esplanaden, der formår at blande god energi og integritet med høj faglighed.




Som en del af H&B Analytics-teamet skal du:

Indgå i analysearbejdet med anvendelse af både traditionelle statistiske teknikker og nyere metoder inden for machine learning – herunder prædiktions- og klassifikationsmodeller – alt afhængigt af problemstilling og datagrundlag.
Bidrage til at sikre den rette form for dataindsamling, der leder hen til kvalitetsinput til vores statistiske analyser
Præsentere indsigter og analyser i et forretningsvenligt format - både skriftligt (PowerPoint) men også mundtligt for klienter
Udarbejde salgsmateriale og bidrage til vidensdeling internt i teamet og på tværs af organisationen
Bidrage opsætning og udvikling af dashboards
Samarbejde med H&B-konsulenter på klassiske management consulting-projekter
Indgå i vores udviklingsteam med fokus på nye analysemetoder, processer og tilgange med henblik på at levere handlingsorienteret indsigt til vores kunder
Være en aktiv del af udviklingen af Analytics-teamet i København med fokus på samarbejde, høj faglighed og et godt arbejdsmiljø




Du bliver en del af et team, hvor vi arbejder tæt sammen og løfter opgaver i flok på tværs af vores kontorer. Vi er et team, som får energi af at lave fede analyser sammen, alt imens der er et vedholdende fokus på udvikling, bidrag og trivsel.




Hvem er du, og hvad søger vi i dig?

Den ideelle kandidat:

Har en relevant videregående uddannelse og solid talforståelse – gerne kombineret med et par års erfaring evt. fra studiejob eller graduate-stilling.
Har praktisk erfaring med kvantitativ metode og statistiske værktøjer som Python, R eller lignende
Har interesse for at arbejde med både simple statistiske analyser og mere komplekse machine learning-modeller, alt afhængig af problemstilling
Tænker forretningsorienteret og motiveres af at levere analyser, der kan omsættes til konkret handling for vores kunder
Har evt. arbejdet med opsætning og vedligeholdelse af dashboards – fx i Power BI, Tableau eller lignende
Trives med at arbejde struktureret og har sans for detaljen – både når det gælder datakvalitet og formidling
Har erfaring med at arbejde i Excel og PowerPoint på et højt niveau
Kommunikerer klart og professionelt – både på dansk og engelsk, skriftligt såvel som mundtligt
Er nysgerrig på nye teknologier, samarbejder naturligt med andre og har lyst til at være med til at udvikle Analytics-teamet i København




Vi sætter dog ikke kun pris på din faglige bagage. Vi søger i lige så høj grad en kollega, der er positiv, samarbejdsvillig, fleksibel og fyldt med god energi, så du kan være med til at udvikle og vækste H&B Analytics.




Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig

Du søger jobbet ved at uploade et fyldestgørende CV og andre relevante dokumenter via linket nedenfor.




Ansøgningsfristen er søndag den 03. august 2025 med opstart hurtigst muligt efterfølgende eller efter aftale. Rekrutteringsprocessen består af tre samtaler, og vi kalder til samtale løbende.




Du kan læse mere om os på hildebrandtbrandi.com/hb-analytics/, men har du opfølgende spørgsmål til stillingen eller til os som virksomhed, er du velkommen til at kontakte:

Recruitment & Culture Consultant Josephine Haslund Henriksen på jhh@hildebrandtbrandi.com eller +45 2829 3728
Senior Analytics Manager Oscar Thykier på oth@hildebrandtbrandi.com eller +45 2620 0479




Bemærk at vi holder sommerferielukket i uge 29 og 30.




Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Show more
HTML:
Analytics Consultant til H&B Analytics i København


H&B Analytics søger en dygtig analytiker med forretningsforståelse, som har lyst til at løse komplekse problemstillinger for vores klienter og som sætter en ære i at omdanne data til actionable insights.


H&B Analytics leverer analyser i verdensklasse via to etablerede brands: H&B | Hildebrandt & Brandi og EPSI Rating Danmark. H&B Analytics er et subbrand til H&B | Hildebrandt & Brandi og derfor en stærk kombination af startup og etableret virksomhed.


Vi sætter en ære i at levere handlingsorienterede indsigter baseret på solide analyser og stærk forretningsforståelse. Teamet deler kontorfaciliteter med H&B og EPSI, og du vil derfor få din daglige gang i et dynamisk miljø med inspirerende kolleger og sjove samtaler ved frokostbordet.


Hvem er vi, og hvad tilbyder vi dig?

Hos H&B Analytics er vores to primære opgaver at løse projekter for og sammen med management konsulenterne i H&B og at drive EPSI Rating Danmark.


I H&B-regi leverer vi komplekse analyser ifm. strategiske projekter for H&B samt prædiktionsmodeller, undersøgelsesdesign og ikke mindst indsigt baseret på data og en bred vifte af analytiske metoder.


I EPSI Rating Danmark tilbyder vi kundetilfredshedsundersøgelser, branchestudier og en lang række andre stakeholder-analyser for førende virksomheder i Danmark.


For begge virksomheder er det essentielt, at vi ikke bare leverer resultater – vi leverer handlingsorienteret indsigt – primært på kunder, men også andre aspekter af virksomheden.


Vores klienter er typisk store, ambitiøse virksomheder, og vi arbejder i langvarige samarbejder, hvor vi engagerer os i klienternes virkelighed både personligt og fagligt for at matche deres behov og situation.


Vi vokser og søger nu en analytiker til vores kontor på Esplanaden, der formår at blande god energi og integritet med høj faglighed.


Som en del af H&B Analytics-teamet skal du:

  • Indgå i analysearbejdet med anvendelse af både traditionelle statistiske teknikker og nyere metoder inden for machine learning – herunder prædiktions- og klassifikationsmodeller – alt afhængigt af problemstilling og datagrundlag.

  • Indgå i vores udviklingsteam med fokus på nye analysemetoder, processer og tilgange med henblik på at levere handlingsorienteret indsigt til vores kunder
  • Være en aktiv del af udviklingen af Analytics-teamet i København med fokus på samarbejde, høj faglighed og et godt arbejdsmiljø


Du bliver en del af et team, hvor vi arbejder tæt sammen og løfter opgaver i flok på tværs af vores kontorer. Vi er et team, som får energi af at lave fede analyser sammen, alt imens der er et vedholdende fokus på udvikling, bidrag og trivsel.

  • Har praktisk erfaring med kvantitativ metode og statistiske værktøjer som Python, R eller lignende
  • Har interesse for at arbejde med både simple statistiske analyser og mere komplekse machine learning-modeller, alt afhængig af problemstilling
  • Tænker forretningsorienteret og motiveres af at levere analyser, der kan omsættes til konkret handling for vores kunder
  • Har evt. arbejdet med opsætning og vedligeholdelse af dashboards – fx i Power BI, Tableau eller lignende
  • Trives med at arbejde struktureret og har sans for detaljen – både når det gælder datakvalitet og formidling
  • Har erfaring med at arbejde i Excel og PowerPoint på et højt niveau
  • Kommunikerer klart og professionelt – både på dansk og engelsk, skriftligt såvel som mundtligt
  • Er nysgerrig på nye teknologier, samarbejder naturligt med andre og har lyst til at være med til at udvikle Analytics-teamet i København

Title: PV & BESS Analyst
Description:
We're Hiring: PV & BESS Performance Analyst

📍 Location: UAE / Saudi Arabia / Uzbekistan Projects

🧠 Experience: Data-Driven Performance Engineering in Solar & Storage Systems




Ever looked at a hybrid energy plant’s performance data and known—just from the numbers—where it’s falling short?

If you don’t wait for alarms, but instead predict issues before they surface—

If SCADA feeds, Python scripts, and storage efficiency reports are where you do your best thinking—

If you understand that energy generation is just the beginning, and performance is where the real value is—

Then read on.




What This Role Actually Is

You’ll sit at the core of performance intelligence for PV, BESS, and hybrid power plants. You’ll turn raw system data into operational improvements. You won’t just report problems—you’ll recommend exactly how to fix them.

This role is for someone who knows what to look for before output drops, before alerts trigger, and before inefficiency becomes cost.




What You'll Be Doing

Monitor live and historical data from PV systems, BESS, and hybrid configurations.
Use platforms like PVsyst, SCADA, Plexos, and Python/Excel to assess energy yields, round-trip efficiency, and degradation patterns.
Generate performance reports that aren’t just readable—they drive decision-making.
Optimize system behavior by coordinating with engineering, O&M, and site teams to implement changes.
Investigate root causes of underperformance and conduct on-site inspections when needed.
Keep an eye on industry trends, grid code changes, and technology updates that impact system output.
Maintain a clear record of what worked, what didn’t, and how to repeat the wins.




What You Need to Bring

Bachelor’s in Engineering, Renewable Energy, or similar. Master’s? Even better.
Experience with renewable energy performance analysis, especially PV and BESS.
You’ve used data tools like Python, R, or Excel—not just for graphs, but for decisions.
You know SCADA environments and how to set up meaningful alerts.
You understand not just what the data says, but why it's saying it—and what to do about it.
You’re fluent in both technical logic and business impact.

Why This Role Matters

This isn’t about watching dashboards. It’s about extracting insight from system behavior and feeding it back into engineering, O&M, and strategy. Your work directly increases plant efficiency, asset value, and uptime.

You won’t just be part of a system—you’ll be part of how it improves itself.

If you already track the pulse of solar + storage systems—and know how to correct it—this is where your skill creates real impact.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Excellent opportunity for an experienced data professional eager to design, build, and maintain scalable and reliable data solutions on Azure.

Do you have a strong background in data engineering and a deep understanding of ETL/ELT, data warehousing, and analytics? Are you proficient in SQL, Python, and Azure Synapse, with a passion for transforming raw data into strategic insights? Then you might be our new Data Engineer!

You will play an important role in:

Everllence PrimeServ is looking for a high performing and detail-oriented Data Engineer to support our journey in elevating data integrity, security, and operational excellence. As a key member of our team, you will:


Develop, deploy, and maintain secure data pipelines, warehouses, and data lakes on Azure following the Medallion Architecture.
Implement and manage CI/CD pipelines to automate and streamline deployments from test to production environments.
Enforce robust governance frameworks including access management, version control, and best practices in code development.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive strategic data governance and security initiatives.
Utilize GitHub best practices for branch management, commit standards, and automated deployments to support continuous integration.


We imagine that you:


You have 2+ years of practical experience working with data engineering and ETL/ELT processes.
You possess a solid background in data architecture and engineering, with hands-on experience in Azure Synapse, CI/CD, and data governance.
Have strong technical skills in SQL, Python, PySpark, and experience working with Azure data services such as Azure Data Factory, Data Lake Storage, Databricks and SQL Database.
Understand secure development practices, version control, and access management protocols.
Are detail-oriented, with a proven ability to document processes, maintain high code quality, and adhere to established conventions.
Are passionate about continuous improvement and operational excellence, ensuring our data solutions are both secure and scalable.
Having Azure Certification and especially DP-203 Azure Data Engineer Associate would be a plus as well as knowledge on Fabric/Databricks.


If you’re ready to drive innovation and help us build a well-governed, secure data ecosystem, we’d love to hear from you!

Welcome to the Data & BI department

You will be a part of the Data & BI department and you will participate in the collaboration with the business stakeholders and within the analytical community across the organization. You will be joining a diverse team of skilled and dedicated people operating in an international environment. We have a professional approach to our work, while having a humorous and positive environment in the team.

What can you expect from us:


Opportunity to participate in a function with many exciting challenges
Unique work experience and reference from a top employer
A young, international and professional environment filled with energy
A job in a trend-setting international company
Work-life balance and continuous trainings.


Unleash your potential: Join us towards a carbon-neutral future

At Everllence, we offer you the chance to shape the future where you can create, drive, build, and be a part of improving innovative energy solutions, while achieving your personal career goals. We prioritize work-life balance with flexible working hours, remote work options, and over 7 weeks of paid time off.

We foster a creative and inclusive culture, emphasizing diversity and equality. We are dedicated to our employees' well-being, offering opportunities to join various social activity clubs, ranging from yoga and fishing to creative clubs.

In 2027, we will consolidate our Zealand locations into one large site in Trekroner, Roskilde.

About Everllence

Everllence, formerly known as MAN Energy Solutions , is a leading provider of propulsion, decarbonization and efficiency solutions for shipping, the energy economy and industry. True to our motto – ‘Moving big things to zero’ – we help key industries in the global economy to reduce hard-to-abate emissions. Our technologies have a measurable impact on the success of the global energy transition. More information about the company can be found at www.everllence.com .

Headquartered in Germany, Everllence employs around 15,000 people across more than 140 sites worldwide. In Denmark, we have over 2,500 dedicated employees from more than 55 nationalities, spread across four locations: Copenhagen, Brøndby, Frederikshavn, and Holeby. Our after-sales brand, Everllence PrimeServ, also supports our customers through its worldwide service-center network.

Build your own Future

Please submit your application to us no later than July 31 2025. We will conduct interviews during the application period. If you have any questions, you are welcome to Piotr Michalak (Piotr.michalak@everllence.com)

Relocating to Denmark is a major step for our international colleagues. To support this transition, we offer tailored intercultural and global mindset training for all employees and managers, promoting a collaborative and inclusive work environment. Our mobility package includes assistance with obtaining a Danish CPR number, tax information, and work permits,

At Everllence, we strive for an inclusive and fair recruitment process for our job applicants based on equity. We encourage all qualified candidates, regardless of gender, age, religion, disability and ethnic background to apply for this position.

Therefore, please refrain from attaching a photo to your CV or cover letter. Furthermore, assistive tools will be available when needed, for example for dyslexia.

Title: Student Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Student Developer

Join our team at Copenhagen Energy Trading




Do you want to be part of a fast-growing energy company with high ambitions, a tech-driven mindset, and plenty of room for personal and professional development? Are you passionate about green energy, software development, and analytics?




Then take a look at this exciting opportunity to develop your skills at Copenhagen Energy Trading – a young and fast-growing energy trading company based in Copenhagen.




What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll join our Tech team, where we build tools that support every part of the trading process – from data pipelines and forecasting models to trading dashboards and automated systems. Everything is built in Python, and we maintain a high standard for clean, well-structured code.




As a student developer, you’ll:

Work on real production tools (not just side projects)
Improve your Python and analytics skills
Learn about power markets and how tech enables trading
Make a real impact from day one, with plenty of freedom and responsibility




You’ll be part of an open and collaborative culture where honesty and transparency shape how we work and grow together. We believe in giving you autonomy, flexibility, and trust, and if things go well, this could lead to a full-time position after graduation.




What We Offer

A student position (15-20 hours per week) with flexible working hours to ensure that you can balance work and studies without compromise
Work alongside experienced and ambitious teammates who set a high bar for quality, and learn what professional software development looks like in the real world.
The opportunity to build your influence and leave your fingerprint on the way we work in a young and fast-growing company
A steep learning curve in a fast-moving, tech-first environment
Competitive pay, team events, and a super friendly vibe
A potential path to a full-time role after graduation




What We’re Looking For

Currently studying a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Passionate about software development with strong programming skills in Python. Experience with other programming languages, such as Go, Rust, or .NET is an advantage but not a requirement
Familiarity with Git and SQL
Interest in energy markets, trading, or solving complex technical problems
A proactive mindset and eagerness to learn from a fast-paced team
Fluent in English (written and spoken)
Bonus: Experience running software in production or building personal projects




Who We Are

Copenhagen Energy Trading A/S was founded in 2021 and is part of Copenhagen Energy Group.




We specialise in short-term power trading across Europe and North America. Technology is at the heart of our operations, supported by a team of top-tier talent. Driven by data and technology, we use deep insights into electricity markets to create discretionary and algorithmic trading strategies that efficiently move power to where it’s needed most.




We believe in a culture of collaborative growth and do not have a system of bureaucratic policies or rigid hierarchy. We support a strong sense of team spirit, surrounded by a like-minded team and an easy-going work culture.




Interested?

All applicants are welcome. At Copenhagen Energy Trading, we believe that diversity, equality, and inclusion are fundamental in the creation of an inspirational workplace that enables us to be innovative and creative. We interview candidates continuously and may select the right candidate prior to the expiry of the job ad. So please do not hesitate to apply.




Application Deadline: August 1, 2025

To apply, submit your cover letter, CV and relevant school diplomas. For more information, you are welcome to contact Jens Christian Johannsen (CTO) at jcj@copenhagen-energy.com or our Recruitment Manager, Anna Schumann, at as@copenhagen-energy.com.

You’ll be part of an open and collaborative culture where honesty and transparency shape how we work and grow together. We believe in giving you autonomy, flexibility, and trust, and if things go well, this could lead to a full-time position after graduation.


What We Offer

  • A student position (15-20 hours per week) with flexible working hours to ensure that you can balance work and studies without compromise
  • Work alongside experienced and ambitious teammates who set a high bar for quality, and learn what professional software development looks like in the real world.
  • The opportunity to build your influence and leave your fingerprint on the way we work in a young and fast-growing company
  • A steep learning curve in a fast-moving, tech-first environment
  • Competitive pay, team events, and a super friendly vibe
  • A potential path to a full-time role after graduation


What We’re Looking For

  • Currently studying a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field.
  • Passionate about software development with strong programming skills in Python. Experience with other programming languages, such as Go, Rust, or .NET is an advantage but not a requirement
  • Familiarity with Git and SQL
  • Interest in energy markets, trading, or solving complex technical problems
  • A proactive mindset and eagerness to learn from a fast-paced team
  • Fluent in English (written and spoken)
  • Bonus: Experience running software in production or building personal projects


Who We Are

Copenhagen Energy Trading A/S was founded in 2021 and is part of Copenhagen Energy Group.


We specialise in short-term power trading across Europe and North America. Technology is at the heart of our operations, supported by a team of top-tier talent. Driven by data and technology, we use deep insights into electricity markets to create discretionary and algorithmic trading strategies that efficiently move power to where it’s needed most.


We believe in a culture of collaborative growth and do not have a system of bureaucratic policies or rigid hierarchy. We support a strong sense of team spirit, surrounded by a like-minded team and an easy-going work culture.


Interested?

All applicants are welcome. At Copenhagen Energy Trading, we believe that diversity, equality, and inclusion are fundamental in the creation of an inspirational workplace that enables us to be innovative and creative. We interview candidates continuously and may select the right candidate prior to the expiry of the job ad. So please do not hesitate to apply.


Application Deadline: August 1, 2025

To apply, submit your cover letter, CV and relevant school diplomas. For more information, you are welcome to contact Jens Christian Johannsen (CTO) at jcj@copenhagen-energy.com or our Recruitment Manager, Anna Schumann, at as@copenhagen-energy.com.

Title: Student Data Scientist (ML)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you a student interested in data and ready to apply your skills to real-world challenges? At Danske Bank, we’re looking for a Student Assistant in Data Science to join our Customer Intelligence team — where we use data and machine learning to better understand and serve our customers.

You’ll support projects that shape how we personalize experiences, predict customer needs, and drive smarter marketing and service decisions.

💼 What You’ll Do

As part of a skilled and supportive team, you’ll assist with a range of tasks that support the development and deployment of machine learning models for retail banking use cases:


Help prepare and explore customer data (transactional, behavioral, demographic)
Support ongoing work on churn prediction, propensity modelling, segmentation, and CLV estimation
Run exploratory analyses and assist with feature engineering and data validation
Contribute to internal documentation, data quality checks, and model evaluation
Learn about model governance, responsible AI, and data-driven decision-making in banking
Work closely with experienced data scientists in an environment focused on learning and collaboration


📚 What We’re Looking For


You’re currently enrolled in a relevant degree (e.g., Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics with a quantitative focus)
You have a strong interest in machine learning, customer behavior, and applied data analytics
You’re comfortable with Python and familiar with tools like pandas, NumPy, or scikit-learn
You’re proactive, analytical, and curious — with a willingness to learn and contribute
You can commit to working 15–20 hours per week alongside your studies


💡 Nice To Have (But Not Required)


Experience working with real-world datasets in a project or internship
Familiarity with SQL, cloud platforms (e.g., Azure), or MLOps tools
Interest in retail banking, financial services, or digital marketing analytics


🌟 What We Offer


A hands-on opportunity to work with real customer data in a leading bank
A friendly and collaborative team culture that values learning and development
Flexible working hours tailored to your academic schedule
The chance to see how AI and data science are used in a highly regulated, customer-focused industry
Working in our new HQ with great facilities


📩 Interested?

Please apply for the position by submitting your CV and cover letter through our careers page or LinkedIn ! Let’s build the future of AI together!

First interviews will take place in August, so don’t hold back!

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Senior Global Logistics Data Analyst - Viby J
Description:
Location

Viby J, DK

Are you passionate about transforming logistics data into actionable insights that drive global impact?

Join us at a pivotal moment as we build our global logistics data analytics foundation—shape how we work, scale, and create value from day one!

"You'll be joining a small, focused team at the early stage of building a global logistics data analytics setup. That means you’ll help shape how we work, how we scale, and how we unlock value from our data foundation,” says Yien Lai Bech.

How You Will Make An Impact

As our new Senior Global Logistics Data Analyst, you will be hands-on in developing structured, well-governed data products that bring clarity to operational decisions. You’ll collaborate closely with both technical and business stakeholders, connecting data, tools, and teams to create scalable impact across our logistics operations.

Your Key Responsibilities


Build and maintain data pipelines, models, and transformations in Databricks (preferably on Azure) using SQL and Python.
Design and optimise mart-layer data models to support self-service analytics and seamless Power BI integration.
Develop advanced Power BI reports, ensuring best practices in data model design, DAX, visualisation, and report performance.
Drive data governance by managing ownership, documentation, access control, and quality monitoring.
Evaluate and harmonise local analytics use cases, guiding standardisation and strategy for global vs. local data ownership.


You will be part of a small, agile team within our global logistics organisation, collaborating across markets. Occasional travel to logistics sites in Denmark, Sweden, Germany, UK, and Poland is expected (20–30 days/year).

What Will Make You Successful

You have a Master’s degree in Supply Chain Management, or a similar field, with a solid academic foundation and work experience in data modelling, statistics, or programming.

We are looking for a hands-on data professional with


Advanced skills in SQL and Python, and extensive experience with Databricks on Azure.
Proven expertise in data architecture (raw, curated, mart layers) and Power BI development.
Familiarity with data governance, documentation, and version control tools like GitHub.
Ability to understand complex logistics operations and translate business needs into structured data solutions.
Strategic thinking to harmonise and scale analytics products, with a proactive, self-directed approach.
At least 3 years’ experience within Supply Chain, with strong project management skills and a deep understanding of production and logistics processes.


What sets you apart is your ability to think beyond the immediate request. You look at local reporting solutions and see opportunities to harmonise, standardise, and scale. You can assess whether something should remain locally owned or be elevated to a global product — and you’re confident making those calls with business stakeholders.

What do we offer?

We’re committed to professional development and promoting from within. Our positive and collaborative culture will bring out the best in you. You’ll join a market leader who produces nutritious household-favourite brands in a way that makes things better for our customers, the farmers who own us, and the whole world. Here, your curiosity and willingness to lead will be valued as you help shape our analytics journey from the ground up.

Would you like to join us?

If you want to play a key role in shaping the future of our global logistics analytics, seize this exciting opportunity. Please apply as soon as possible, as we will process applications on a continuous basis and close the recruitment once the right candidate is found.

For additional information, please contact Senior Logistics Development Manager, Yien Lai Bech at +45 9131 2840.

Shape the Future of Dairy

Arla is a global leader in the dairy industry, committed to producing high-quality products while championing sustainability and innovation. We're passionate about people and our planet, striving to unleash the full potential in each of us. Our goal is to make healthy dairy nutrition and good food habits accessible to all. Join us at Arla Foods and become part of a worldwide cooperative dedicated to making a significant impact on the planet and steering the dairy industry towards a sustainable future.

We are devoted to creating a workplace where everyone feels valued and empowered to bring their authentic selves to work. Diversity and collaboration are key to our success, propelling us to new heights in the dairy industry.

Ref. 101873

Title: Analytics Engineer (9-month contract)
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Do you want to help us build a data-driven culture for digital product development? We have an amazing job opportunity for you!

We are looking for an Analytics Engineer in our Data, Analytics & Business Improvement team. Come and help us build a robust behavioral analytics platform for our portfolio of consumer-facing LEGO websites, apps, and other owned experiences.


Core Responsibilities

Partner with multiple digital product teams to define & implement our data model, ensuring we have a scalable way of turning raw data from a range of sources into structured tables and data feeds that are aligned with the most common business questions requiring analysis and reporting





Work with Analytics Business Partners in the team to play an active role bridging the gap between business needs, technical possibilities, and privacy compliance requirements – Play a leading role to define the analytics infrastructure strategy for Digital Consumer Engagement.
Design and create a semantic & reporting layer for our suite of digital products, including the build and maintenance of DBT models for our behavioral analytics platform.
Partner with the LEGO Data Office to develop standards and ways of working for data producers and data consumers across Digital Consumer Engagement and embed these across digital product teams (data quality, data ownership, documentation, code standards, etc.).
Support and/or manage ad-hoc third party data ingestions to the LEGO Data Platforms required, such as App Store Data, Media Agency Reporting, etc.
Actively build and collaborate with a cross-functional data & analytics network to develop and embed standards for data modelling, data management, code standards, and documentation – ensure that we are set up to scale as our digital capabilities grow.
Maintain a continual outside-in focus and drive our team’s understanding of the latest technologies and methods of managing and analyzing large data sets.




Play your part in our team succeeding

The Data, Analytics & Business Improvement team is an analytics and continuous improvement practice within the LEGO Group’s Digital Consumer Engagement (DCE) function. Our focus is on establishing two-way, long-lasting and meaningful relationships with our consumers and shoppers. We believe that the ethical, transparent, and effective use of consumer data is key to this ambition.

We are seeking a dedicated analytics enablement specialist to join our team and lead the set-up of our data platform and analytics reporting layer for a domain within the team. Partner closely with our Data Office and engineers across digital product teams, and work with analytics business partners to transform raw data into a reusable format that can be used for analysis & reporting. Join a team of likeminded people who collectively are shaping how we approach analytics on our LEGO owned apps and websites!

Do you have what it takes?

Formal training in software development, product management, agile, or digital analytics and at least 2-3 years’ experience in a similar role





Deep, hands-on mastery of SQL, and ideally one of Python and/or R – This role is a technical profile and requires someone with a deep passion for analyzing large structured and unstructured data sets.
Hands on experience with the set up and maintenance of bronze, silver, and gold layers in a big data platform, ideally Databricks and Apache Spark. And experience building and maintaining DBT models.
A desire and passion for transforming raw data into structured tables which can answer common business questions.
Proven experience working with behavioral data across web & app platforms.
Comfort with ambiguity, and a natural preference for an environment where you play an active role in defining the solution to complex and undefined problems – We’re looking for a lynchpin who isn’t afraid to get things done even when they don’t have formal authority over everyone who needs to be involved to make it work, and is able to build collaborative working relationships across organizational boundaries.
Build trusted working relationships with both technical and non-technical colleagues and partners, and a demonstrated ability to simplify complex topics to those less familiar with data infrastructure.




This is a 9-month temporary position based in either Billund, Denmark or London, UK. Relocation support is not available for this role.

Nice to Have





Experience with applied statistics across multiple data sources
Passion for advanced data science & machine learning methodologies
Experience ingesting owned and 3rd party data sources into a central data platform, and building/maintaining data pipelines including working with and building APIs
Experience working with global teams across multiple geographies and cultures is an asset




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

Title: Junior Data Scientist (student) at Choreograph
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Choreograph søger en Junior Data Scientist med passion for at omsætte data til indsigter

Er du vild med økonomi, statistik og matematisk modellering? Trives du med at finde mønstre i data og omsætte dem til meningsfulde indsigter i Python – eller andre statistiske programmeringssprog? Så er det måske dig, vi leder efter. Vi søger en bachelor- eller kandidatstuderende, der ved siden af sin videregående uddannelse ønsker at være en del af regnekraften bag rådgivningen til Nordens største virksomheder.

Hvem er vi?

Choreograph er en del af WPP Media, som er Nordens største bureaugruppe. Vi arbejder med rådgivning inden for marketing, media og salg. I data science-delen af Choreograph er udgangspunktet for vores rådgivning altid forskellige former for matematisk og statistisk analyse – herunder salgsmodeller, media buying-algoritmer, geografiske eksperimenter, dashboards m.m. Vi arbejder tæt sammen i et fagligt stærkt og anerkendt team, hvor nøgleordene er innovation, selvstændighed og faglig stolthed. Læs mere om os her: Choreograph

Jobbet

Vores kunder har store datasæt, komplekse problemstillinger og sammen skal vi omsætte de analytiske resultater til konkrete anbefalinger. En del af den tekniske udfordring er, at datamængderne konstant vokser og bliver stadig mere komplekse. Du skal være med til at løse denne udfordring. Sammen med en data scientist skal du på professionel vis håndtere kundens data, levere rådgivning og præsentere anbefalinger, som optimerer kundens investeringer baseret på et solidt analytisk grundlag.

Din daglige rutine som studentermedhjælper vil hovedsageligt være at opdatere, automatisere og klargøre data til analyser, samt opsætte indledende resultater i PowerPoint og PowerBI, alt imens du opbygger solid viden om branchen og de anvendte metoder.

Faglige og personlige kvalifikationer

Du er blandt årgangens skarpeste inden for økonomi, matematisk optimering, databehandling, statistik og/eller økonometri. Efter et introduktionsforløb, hvor du bliver fortrolig med vores anvendte datakilder og systemer, vil du selvstændigt arbejde med databehandlingen og udarbejdelse af præsentationer – i takt med, at du stifter bekendtskab med branchen, vil du få muligheden for at bistå i rådgivningen til virksomhederne og derved udvikle dine færdigheder som konsulent.

Vi forestiller os, at du:


Er i gang med en uddannelse, der giver et solidt fundament inden for økonomi og statistik
Har arbejdet med Microsoft Office-pakken (særligt PowerPoint og Excel), har kendskab til programmeringssprog som Python, og enten har erfaring med - eller interesse for - at arbejde med cloud-løsninger som Google BigQuery og SQL-baserede databaser
Er grundig, trives med at arbejde selvstændigt, og er god til at overholde deadlines
Har en vis forståelse for statistisk programmering og evt. dashboardløsninger


Vi tilbyder

Et fagligt udfordrende studiejob på ca. 15-20 timer om ugen i et engageret og dynamisk team med mere end 60 dygtige kollegaer fra hele Norden. Vi er en social gruppe, der holder af at tilbringe tid sammen uden for arbejdstiden blandt andet med padel, funktionel træning, karaoke, i fredagsbaren samt ture til udlandet, hvor vi til oktober planlægger en tur til Budapest.

Vi har højt til loftet og forventer at vores medarbejdere arbejder selvstændigt og er proaktive. Det er vores klare ambition, at du efter at have færdiggjort din uddannelse har mulighed for og lyst til at blive en del af vores organisation som fastansat.

Vores kontor ligger på Holmbladsgade 133, bag Kløvermarken på Amager, i gåafstand til Lergravsparken Metro. Vi har en fremragende kantine, hvor vi også tilbyder morgenmad, samt en masse sociale arrangementer i løbet af året, attraktive personalegoder og meget mere.

Ansøgning

Hvis ovenstående passer på dig, så send din ansøgning, CV og relevante dokumenter via linket på denne side. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte vores Talent Lead Johan Hillers på johan.hillers@WPPMedia.com

requisitionid:13178
Show more
HTML:
Choreograph søger en Junior Data Scientist med passion for at omsætte data til indsigter

Er du vild med økonomi, statistik og matematisk modellering? Trives du med at finde mønstre i data og omsætte dem til meningsfulde indsigter i Python – eller andre statistiske programmeringssprog? Så er det måske dig, vi leder efter. Vi søger en bachelor- eller kandidatstuderende, der ved siden af sin videregående uddannelse ønsker at være en del af regnekraften bag rådgivningen til Nordens største virksomheder.

Hvem er vi?

Choreograph er en del af WPP Media, som er Nordens største bureaugruppe. Vi arbejder med rådgivning inden for marketing, media og salg. I data science-delen af Choreograph er udgangspunktet for vores rådgivning altid forskellige former for matematisk og statistisk analyse – herunder salgsmodeller, media buying-algoritmer, geografiske eksperimenter, dashboards m.m. Vi arbejder tæt sammen i et fagligt stærkt og anerkendt team, hvor nøgleordene er innovation, selvstændighed og faglig stolthed. Læs mere om os her: Choreograph

Jobbet

Vores kunder har store datasæt, komplekse problemstillinger og sammen skal vi omsætte de analytiske resultater til konkrete anbefalinger. En del af den tekniske udfordring er, at datamængderne konstant vokser og bliver stadig mere komplekse. Du skal være med til at løse denne udfordring. Sammen med en data scientist skal du på professionel vis håndtere kundens data, levere rådgivning og præsentere anbefalinger, som optimerer kundens investeringer baseret på et solidt analytisk grundlag.

Din daglige rutine som studentermedhjælper vil hovedsageligt være at opdatere, automatisere og klargøre data til analyser, samt opsætte indledende resultater i PowerPoint og PowerBI, alt imens du opbygger solid viden om branchen og de anvendte metoder.

Faglige og personlige kvalifikationer

Du er blandt årgangens skarpeste inden for økonomi, matematisk optimering, databehandling, statistik og/eller økonometri. Efter et introduktionsforløb, hvor du bliver fortrolig med vores anvendte datakilder og systemer, vil du selvstændigt arbejde med databehandlingen og udarbejdelse af præsentationer – i takt med, at du stifter bekendtskab med branchen, vil du få muligheden for at bistå i rådgivningen til virksomhederne og derved udvikle dine færdigheder som konsulent.

Vi forestiller os, at du:

  • Er i gang med en uddannelse, der giver et solidt fundament inden for økonomi og statistik
  • Har arbejdet med Microsoft Office-pakken (særligt PowerPoint og Excel), har kendskab til programmeringssprog som Python, og enten har erfaring med - eller interesse for - at arbejde med cloud-løsninger som Google BigQuery og SQL-baserede databaser
  • Er grundig, trives med at arbejde selvstændigt, og er god til at overholde deadlines
  • Har en vis forståelse for statistisk programmering og evt. dashboardløsninger

Vi tilbyder

Et fagligt udfordrende studiejob på ca. 15-20 timer om ugen i et engageret og dynamisk team med mere end 60 dygtige kollegaer fra hele Norden. Vi er en social gruppe, der holder af at tilbringe tid sammen uden for arbejdstiden blandt andet med padel, funktionel træning, karaoke, i fredagsbaren samt ture til udlandet, hvor vi til oktober planlægger en tur til Budapest.

Vi har højt til loftet og forventer at vores medarbejdere arbejder selvstændigt og er proaktive. Det er vores klare ambition, at du efter at have færdiggjort din uddannelse har mulighed for og lyst til at blive en del af vores organisation som fastansat.

Vores kontor ligger på Holmbladsgade 133, bag Kløvermarken på Amager, i gåafstand til Lergravsparken Metro. Vi har en fremragende kantine, hvor vi også tilbyder morgenmad, samt en masse sociale arrangementer i løbet af året, attraktive personalegoder og meget mere.

Ansøgning

Hvis ovenstående passer på dig, så send din ansøgning, CV og relevante dokumenter via linket på denne side. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte vores Talent Lead Johan Hillers på johan.hillers@WPPMedia.com

requisitionid:13178

Title: Data Scientist for AI Centre of Excellence
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Would you like to be part of a team focused on solving real-world business problems by transforming our approach to how we work with data and AI/machine learning at scale at Danske Bank?

With clear ties to our Forward ’28 Group Strategy, Group Data & Analytics is now creating the foundation for leveraging data and AI/ML capabilities. We are currently ramping up to build a highly specialised team that partners with our core business and development teams to deliver solutions that elevate data-driven decision-making and add value to our portfolio of existing and new IT applications.

To do so, we have recently established an AI & Data Science team that will empower the organisation to leverage data and AI technologies to deliver business value and benefits.

Not only do we want to build things right, but just as importantly, we want to build the right things—which, in the era of AI and all the hype that comes with it, can be a challenge. You will play a key role in striking that balance.

As part of our migration to AWS, you will also be involved in moving to our future Data Science platform to help accelerate the impact of machine learning across Danske Bank. This will happen in close collaboration with peers in other teams across the organisation. You will promote clear directions for standards, best practices, and ways of working with data science as formulated by our team.

Depending on your experience and knowledge, we may offer you different levels of seniority in the role.

Please be informed that interviews will be held in mid-August.

About you:


Hands-on experimentation and proof-of-value in our lab environment
Scope and deliver end-to-end AI solutions
Guide and educate data scientists and data engineers throughout our organisation in relation to both methods and platform/tooling
Cultivate strong relationships with data scientists and business experts across the organisation


You will:


Outcome-oriented with a focus on solving problems
Effective communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to bring the right stakeholders together
Curious about product development and technology trends, with a keen interest in knowledge and self-improvement
Strong in mathematics, statistics, and machine learning
Experience with the following or similar technologies: Python, Spark/PySpark, Airflow, SQL, Public cloud providers, particularly AWSD, databricks, FastAPI, MLflow, Monitoring frameworks (g., Prometheus, Grafana), Containerisation (g., Kubernetes, Docker, OpenShift), CI/CD, pipelines, Git/Azure DevOps
Upper-intermediate English skills
Experience with Design Thinking or a similar UX framework would be beneficial


“We believe that the most valuable asset is human potential.”

We offer:

This position can be located both in Lithuania and Denmark. If the position is located in Lithuania the monthly salary range will be from 2680 EUR to 4020 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package (benefits are only valid for Lithuania the same as the salary ranges) which includes:

Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.


Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


See all the benefits in Lithuania HERE .

Your title in job contract will be Data Scientist.

Curiosity, excitement, teamwork, and a near-obsession with understanding our frontline business are what I believe it will take to co-create the best data and AI solutions for our business. If you're interested in this role and joining my team, feel free to contact me - Michael Thruesen on LinkedIn , and I will be happy to answer your questions!

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Graduate Data Scientist
Place: Vester Hassing, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
The Company

Veovo is a market leader in Airport Smart Technology. With a global footprint of customers and capabilities that cover Airport Operations, Revenue management and Passenger Flow. Some of the world’s largest airports rely on Veovo.  Focused on driving airport performance, our solutions enable airports to handle more aircraft and more passengers, with less delays and less queues. Our platforms are built on a modern tech stack, often delivered from the cloud as SaaS and leveraging intelligence to enable our customer to “go brilliantly”.

Our clients span continents, but all share one thing in common~ they’re big names in airport excellence, with even bigger digital goals. With offices in the UK, Poland, Denmark, New Zealand and the US, Veovo offers a world of opportunity

At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports. At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports.

The Opportunity

We focus on solutions in the analysis of queue and movement patterns as well as capacity forecasts. Our product, is cloud-based system that collects and analyzes data via proprietary (Bluetooth / WiFi) sensors, as well as third-party data sources such as camera, radar, infrared counters, coils, boarding cards, calendars, etc.

The solution primarily helps airports to forecast passenger appearance, optimize staff resources, reduce queue and travel times, and improve the experience for the passengers. In addition, we also create solutions for road traffic, railway stations, ports, ski resorts and amusement parks, with similar work and end-results.

Are you ready to be part of the team that brings our brilliant solutions "live" around the world?

The size of our installations are growing rapidly, and we are therefore seeking a skilled analytical person, who can help implement our solutions to help airports predict passenger arrival and flow. The implementation covers requirements, design, and calibration of the system. The calibration is carried out in-house via the setup of our filtering engine.

The Specifics


Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
Combine models through ensemble modeling
Present information using data visualization techniques
Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges
Collaborate with engineering and product development teams


What we are looking for


Knowledge of R, SQL and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java or C++ is an asset
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
Analytical mind and business acumen
Experience in data mining
Problem-solving aptitude
Excellent communication and presentation skills


What we offer in return


A job in a growing industry.
Employment immediately or by agreement.
An exciting position in a company with good working conditions with an open, direct and informal tone
A company where ideas are accelerated into action, and everyone can play a part in the development.
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development through independent work assignments.
Workplace~ Hækken 2, Vester Hassing, 9310 Vodskov
37 hours working week

Title: Senior Product Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 116 million registered users and 243,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 431+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.165.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

At Too Good To Go we interact with our users and partners through Product Teams dedicated to our consumer apps and our partner platform. As a Senior Product Analyst, your mission is to provide analytical and product expertise to ensure that we are continuously delivering value to our Independent Partners and the business. You will analyse large volume data sets in order to deliver high-level insights and actionable recommendations, and work with prototyping new concepts and means of utilising data as a value-add.

The Role


Partner with the product manager to drive strategy based on insights from analyses and experiments
Conduct quantitative research to uncover opportunities and insights relevant for your product team
Setup, run and document experiments on features and ideas
Establish, and monitor common metrics that align with team goals and product strategy
Ensure features are tracked, tested and documented
Ensure that the product team understands and has access to the metrics and insights from your analysis.
Ensure all stakeholders, including those outside of your immediate team are well informed about relevant insights and experiments


Requirements


Proven experience in effectively communicating analytical findings, influencing decision-making processes with data-driven insights
Experience working with SQL and Python (or R)
Exposure to working with digital consumer facing products, ideally marketplaces or e-commerce platforms
Experience handling basic automations, calling API’s etc. in Python
Experience with event tracking in Amplitude, Mixpanel, Looker or similar is a plus
Sound knowledge of conducting experiments and forming hypotheses
Technical curiosity - we want you to be comfortable asking questions - we encourage a mindset to ‘dig deeper’
Full professional proficiency in English
Established background in a data related product role, we are ready to welcome candidates that may not be currently holding a Senior position


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We can do it if we win together as Waste Warriors with no ego. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.


Show more

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you thrive at the intersection of data and strategy? Are you excited about turning complex analytics into impactful marketing insights? Then you might be our new Marketing Data Analyst, ready to join our dynamic and international marketing team!

First, who on earth is Dalux?

Dalux is an innovative Contech company committed to push the boundaries of how technology can secure a smarter and more efficient construction and real estate industry. Today we provide our user-friendly digital tools and BIM Technology (3D information models) to leading contractors and advisors in more than 147 countries. And we are not slowing down our expansion journey anytime soon, so this is a great time to join us and directly influence the future of Dalux! Today we are present in 24 countries and counting, and therefore this is a great time to join us, and directly influence the future of Dalux!

Awesome! But what will my new role be?

In this role, you’ll work at the intersection of data and marketing, analyzing and interpreting data from a wide variety of marketing channels such as ads, social media, website performance, webinars, events, and more. Your insights will drive decision-making, shape marketing strategies, and optimize performance across the organization.

Your responsibilities will include:


Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data from various marketing sources (e.g., Google Analytics, Google Ads, social platforms, events, webinars).
Developing and maintaining dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, SQL, and Access.
Providing actionable insights to optimize campaign performance and achieve marketing goals.
Collaborating with Performance Marketing and other teams (Content, Events, Commercial Revenue Operations) to align on data-driven strategies.
Monitoring and reporting on KPIs, campaign ROI, and trends to guide both short-term and long-term planning.
Identifying areas of opportunity and proposing data-informed strategies for growth and efficiency.


Sure, sounds exciting! How can I be considered for this role?

You have +5 years of experience in marketing data analysis or a related field, with proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and Microsoft Access. Strong knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Ads dashboards, as well as analytical and problem-solving skills, are essential. Experience visualizing data for non-technical stakeholders and strong collaboration skills are also key.

Preferred qualifications include experience in performance marketing or commercial revenue operations, familiarity with A/B testing, and additional data visualization tools.

If you’re collaborative, curious, and eager to learn, you’ll thrive in our supportive and creative environment.

Why Choose Dalux?

At Dalux, we care—not just about our work and customers but about each other. We believe in creating a work environment that is light-hearted, informal, and welcoming, with room for everyone. Forget fancy titles and rigid dress codes; we’re here to make your work life both rewarding and enjoyable.

At our HQ in Østerbro, you’ll join a team of 17 skilled colleagues dedicated to driving high customer engagement. Networking with our users is our passion, and we deliver great content, engaging events, and cutting-edge ConTech insights.

Being part of a social company, you’ll also enjoy activities like wine tasting, running club, knitting club, and more. At Dalux, your personal and professional growth is important to us.

Application deadline:

As soon as possible
